If syncOffsetIndicator-v1430 is configured, the UE shall ignore the field syncOffsetIndicator-r12. E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator1 in v2x-CommPreconfigSync within SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, if configured. E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator2 is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator2 in v2x-CommPreconfigSync within SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, if configured. E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator3 is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator3 in v2x-CommPreconfigSync within SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, if configured. E-UTRAN should ensure all values in syncOffsetIndicator are same across all carrier frequencies configured for UEs performing V2X sidelink communication on multiple carrier frequencies. For SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, all values in syncOffsetIndicator should be same across all carrier frequencies configured for UEs performing V2X sidelink communication on multiple carrier frequencies.
syncOffsetIndicator in chapter5

In SL-SyncConfig field description (gnss-Sync): if configured, the synchronization configuration is used for SLSS transmission/reception when the UE is synchronized to GNSS, by using slssid=0 and ignoring slssid-r12 configured. If not configured, the synchronization configuration is used for SLSS transmission/reception when the UE is synchronized to eNB, by using the configured slssid-r12.
gnss-Sync in chapter5

In SL-SyncConfig field description (slss-TxDisabled): Value TRUE indicates that the carrier, even though equipped with synchronisation resources, cannot be used as a synchronisation carrier frequency to transmit SLSS or PSBCH.
This parameter cannot be included in SystemInformationBlockType21 or SystemInformationBlockType26.
slss-TxDisabled in chapter5
SL-SyncConfigNFreq-r13:
In SL-CP-Len section description: The IE SL-CP-Len indicates the cyclic prefix length, see TS 36.211 [21].

In SL-SyncConfig field description (syncCP-Len): In case of V2X sidelink communications this field is always configured to normal.

In SL-SyncConfig field description (syncOffsetIndicator): E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator1 or syncOffsetIndicator2 in preconfigSync within SL-Preconfiguration, if configured. If syncOffsetIndicator-v1430 is configured, the UE shall ignore the field syncOffsetIndicator-r12. E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator1 in v2x-CommPreconfigSync within SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, if configured. E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator2 is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator2 in v2x-CommPreconfigSync within SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, if configured. E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator3 is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator3 in v2x-CommPreconfigSync within SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, if configured. E-UTRAN should ensure all values in syncOffsetIndicator are same across all carrier frequencies configured for UEs performing V2X sidelink communication on multiple carrier frequencies. For SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, all values in syncOffsetIndicator should be same across all carrier frequencies configured for UEs performing V2X sidelink communication on multiple carrier frequencies.
syncOffsetIndicator in chapter5

In SLSSID section description: The IE SLSSID identifies a cell and is used by the receiving UE to detect asynchronous neighbouring cells, and by transmitting UEs to extend the synchronisation signals beyond the cell's coverage area.

In SL-SyncConfig field description (txParameters): Includes parameters relevant only for transmission. E-UTRAN includes the field in one entry per list, as included in commSyncConfig or discSyncConfig.
txParameters in chapter5
In SL-TxParameters section description: The IE SL-TxParameters identifies a set of parameters configured for sidelink transmission, used for communication, discovery and synchronisation.

In SL-SyncConfig field description (syncTxThreshIC): Indicates the threshold used while in coverage. In case the RSRP measurement of the cell chosen for transmission of sidelink communication/ discovery announcements/ V2X sidelink communication, or of the cell used as reference for DL measurements and synchronization, is below the level indicated by this field, the UE may transmit SLSS (i.e. become synchronisation reference) when performing the corresponding sidelink transmission..
syncTxThreshIC in chapter5

In SL-SyncConfig field description (syncInfoReserved): Reserved for future use.
syncInfoReserved in chapter5

In SL-SyncConfig field description (syncTxPeriodic): Indicates whether in each discovery period in which UE transmits discovery, the UE transmits SLSS once or periodically (i.e. every 40ms). In the latter case (periodic) the UE also transmits the MasterInformationBlock-SL message alongside. E-UTRAN configures this field only for synchronisation configurations applicable for PS discovery.
syncTxPeriodic in chapter5

In SL-SyncConfig field description (discSyncWindow): Indicates the synchronization window over which the UE expects that SLSS or discovery resources indicated by the pool configuration (see TS 36.213 [23], clause 14.4). The value w1 denotes 5 milliseconds. The value w2 denotes the length corresponding to normal cyclic prefix divided by 2.

In SL-SyncConfig field description (syncOffsetIndicator): E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator1 or syncOffsetIndicator2 in preconfigSync within SL-Preconfiguration, if configured. If syncOffsetIndicator-v1430 is configured, the UE shall ignore the field syncOffsetIndicator-r12. E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator1 in v2x-CommPreconfigSync within SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, if configured. E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator2 is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator2 in v2x-CommPreconfigSync within SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, if configured. E-UTRAN should ensure syncOffsetIndicator3 is set to the same value as syncOffsetIndicator3 in v2x-CommPreconfigSync within SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, if configured. E-UTRAN should ensure all values in syncOffsetIndicator are same across all carrier frequencies configured for UEs performing V2X sidelink communication on multiple carrier frequencies. For SL-V2X-Preconfiguration, all values in syncOffsetIndicator should be same across all carrier frequencies configured for UEs performing V2X sidelink communication on multiple carrier frequencies.
syncOffsetIndicator in chapter5

In SL-SyncConfig field description (gnss-Sync): if configured, the synchronization configuration is used for SLSS transmission/reception when the UE is synchronized to GNSS, by using slssid=0 and ignoring slssid-r12 configured. If not configured, the synchronization configuration is used for SLSS transmission/reception when the UE is synchronized to eNB, by using the configured slssid-r12.
gnss-Sync in chapter5

In SL-SyncConfig field description (slss-TxDisabled): Value TRUE indicates that the carrier, even though equipped with synchronisation resources, cannot be used as a synchronisation carrier frequency to transmit SLSS or PSBCH.
This parameter cannot be included in SystemInformationBlockType21 or SystemInformationBlockType26.
slss-TxDisabled in chapter5
SL-TF-ResourceConfig-r12: In SL-TF-ResourceConfig section description: The IE SL-TF-ResourceConfig specifies a set of time/ frequency resources used for sidelink.

In SL-TF-ResourceConfig field description (prb-Num): Sidelink transmissions on a sub-frame can occur on PRB with index greater than or equal to prb-Start and less than prb-Start + prb-Num, and on PRB with index greater than prb-End - prb-Num and less than or equal to prb-End. Even for neighbouring cells, prb-Start and prb-End are relative to PRB #0 of the cell from which it was obtained. See TS 36.213 [23], clauses 14.1.3, 14.2.3 and 14.3.3.

In SL-TF-ResourceConfig field description (prb-Start): Sidelink transmissions on a sub-frame can occur on PRB with index greater than or equal to prb-Start and less than prb-Start + prb-Num, and on PRB with index greater than prb-End - prb-Num and less than or equal to prb-End. Even for neighbouring cells, prb-Start and prb-End are relative to PRB #0 of the cell from which it was obtained. See TS 36.213 [23], clauses 14.1.3, 14.2.3 and 14.3.3.

In SL-TF-ResourceConfig field description (prb-End): Sidelink transmissions on a sub-frame can occur on PRB with index greater than or equal to prb-Start and less than prb-Start + prb-Num, and on PRB with index greater than prb-End - prb-Num and less than or equal to prb-End. Even for neighbouring cells, prb-Start and prb-End are relative to PRB #0 of the cell from which it was obtained. See TS 36.213 [23], clauses 14.1.3, 14.2.3 and 14.3.3.

In SL-OffsetIndicator section description: The IE SL-OffsetIndicator indicates the offset of the pool of resources relative to SFN 0 of the cell from which it was obtained or, when out of coverage, relative to DFN 0.

In SL-TF-ResourceConfig field description (subframeBitmap): Indicates the subframe bitmap indicating resources used for sidelink. For sidelink communication, E-UTRAN configures value bs40 for FDD and the following values for TDD: value bs42 for configuration0, value bs16 for configuration1, value bs8 for configuration2, value bs12 for configuration3, value bs8 for configuration4, value bs4 for configuration5 and value bs30 for configuration6. For V2X sidelink communication, E-UTRAN configures value bs16, bs20 or bs100 for FDD or Frame Structure Type 1 as defined in TS 36.211 [21],and the following values for TDD or Frame Structure Type 2 as defined in TS 36.211 [21]: value bs60 for configuration0, value bs40 for configuration1, value bs20 for configuration2, value bs30 for configuration3, value bs20 for configuration4, value bs10 for configuration5 and value bs50 for configuration6.
SL-TxPower-r14: In SL-TxPower section description: The IE SL-TxPower is used to limit the UE's sidelink transmission power on a carrier frequency. The unit is dBm. Value minusinfinity corresponds to -infinity.
SL-TypeTxSync-r14: In SL-TypeTxSync section description: The IE SL-TypeTxSync indicates the synchronization reference type.
SL-ThresPSSCH-RSRP-List-r14: In SL-ThresPSSCH-RSRP-List section description: IE SL-ThresPSSCH-RSRP-List indicates a threshold used for sensing based UE autonomous resource selection (see TS 36.213 [23]). A resource is excluded if it is indicated or reserved by a decoded SCI and PSSCH RSRP in the associated data resource is above the threshold defined by IE SL-ThresPSSCH-RSRP-List.
SL-TxParameters-r12: In SL-TxParameters section description: The IE SL-TxParameters identifies a set of parameters configured for sidelink transmission, used for communication, discovery and synchronisation.
ENUMERATED {al0, al04, al05, al06, al07, al08, al09, al1}

In SL-TxParameters field description (alpha): Parameter(s): ,,,,,,, See TS 36.213 [23], clauses 14.1.1.5, 14.2.1.3, 14.3.1 and 14.4, where al0 corresponds to 0, al04 corresponds to value 0.4, al05 to 0.5, al06 to 0.6, al07 to 0.7, al08 to 0.8, al09 to 0.9 and al1 corresponds to 1. This field applies for sidelink power control.
In SL-TxParameters field description (p0): Parameter: ,,,,,,, see TS 36.213 [23], clauses 14.1.1.5, 14.2.1.3, 14.3.1 and 14.4, unit dBm.
SL-TxPoolIdentity-r12: In SL-TxPoolIdentity section description: The IE SL-TxPoolIdentity identifies an individual pool entry configured for sidelink transmission, used for communication and discovery.
SL-TxPoolToReleaseList-r12: In SL-TxPoolToReleaseList section description: The IE SL-TxPoolToReleaseList is used to release one or more individual pool entries used for sidelink transmission, for communication and discovery.
In SL-TxPoolIdentity section description: The IE SL-TxPoolIdentity identifies an individual pool entry configured for sidelink transmission, used for communication and discovery.
SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated-r14:
In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated section description: The IE SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated specifies the dedicated configuration information for V2X sidelink communication.
SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated in chapter5

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (scheduled): Indicates the configuration for the case E-UTRAN schedules the transmission resources based on sidelink specific BSR from the UE.
scheduled in chapter5

In C-RNTI section description: The IE C-RNTI identifies a UE having a RRC connection within a cell.

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (sl-V-RNTI): Indicates the RNTI used for DCI dynamically scheduling sidelink resources for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (v2x-SchedulingPool): Indicates a pool of resources when E-UTRAN schedules Tx resources for V2X sidelink communications.
v2x-SchedulingPool in chapter5

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (mcs): Indicates the MCS as defined in TS 36.213 [23], clause 14.2.1. If not configured, the selection of MCS is up to UE implementation. If included, mcs-r14 corresponds to the MCS table in Table 8.6.1-1 with 64QAM indices overridden by 16QAM used for transmission on PSSCH. If included, mcs-r15 corresponds to both the MCS table in Table 8.6.1-1 in TS 36.213 [23] and the MCS table supporting 64QAM in Table 14.1.1-2 in TS 36.213 [23] used for transmission on PSSCH. If this field is present, E-UTRAN shall configure both mcs-r14 and mcs-r15.

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (logicalChGroupInfoList): Indicates for each logical channel group the list of associated priorities and reliabilities, used as specified in TS 36.321 [6], in order of increasing logical channel group identity. If E-UTRAN includes logicalChGroupInfoList-v1530, it includes the same number of entries, and listed in the same order, as in logicalChGroupInfoList–r14, and a logical channel group identity of the same entry in logicalChGroupInfoList-r14 and in logicalChGroupInfo-v1530 is associated with both the priorties (as in logicalChGroupInfoList-r14) and reliablities (as in logicalChGroupInfoList-v-1520) of that entry. If logicalChGroupInfoList-v1530 is not included, this field indicates for each logical channel group the list of associated priorties.

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (ue-Selected): Indicates the configuration for the case the UE selects the transmission resources from a pool of resources configured by E-UTRAN.
ue-Selected in chapter5
In SL-CommTxPoolSensingConfig section description: The IE SL-CommTxPoolSensingConfig specifies V2X sidelink communication configurations used for UE autonomous resource selection.

In SL-InterFreqInfoListV2X section description: The IE SL-InterFreqInfoListV2X indicates synchronization and resource allocation configurations of the neighboring frequency for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (v2x-InterFreqInfoList): Indicates synchronization and resource allocation configurations of other carrier frequencies than the serving carrier frequency for V2X sidelink communication. For inter-carrier scheduled resource allocation, CIF=1 in DCI-5A corresponds to the first entry in this frequency list, CIF=2 corresponds to the second entry, and so on (see TS 36.213 [23]). CIF=0 in DCI-5A corresponds to the frequency where the DCI is received.
v2x-InterFreqInfoList in chapter5

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (thresSL-TxPrioritization): Indicates the threshold used to determine whether SL V2X transmission is prioritized over uplink transmission if they overlap in time (see TS 36.321 [6]). This value shall overwrite thresSL-TxPrioritization configured in SIB21 or SL-V2X-Preconfiguration if any.

In SL-TypeTxSync section description: The IE SL-TypeTxSync indicates the synchronization reference type.

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (typeTxSync): Indicates the prioritized synchronization type (i.e. eNB or GNSS) for performing V2X sidelink communication on PCell.
typeTxSync in chapter5

In SL-CBR-CommonTxConfigList section description: The IE SL-CBR-CommonTxConfigList indicates the list of PSSCH transmission parameters (such as MCS, sub-channel number, retransmission number, CR limit) in sl-CBR-PSSCH-TxConfigList, and the list of CBR ranges in cbr-RangeCommonConfigList, to configure congestion control to the UE for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (cbr-DedicatedTxConfigList): Indicates the dedicated list of CBR range division and the list of PSCCH TX configurations available to configure congestion control to the UE for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (scheduled): Indicates the configuration for the case E-UTRAN schedules the transmission resources based on sidelink specific BSR from the UE.
scheduled in chapter5

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (logicalChGroupInfoList): Indicates for each logical channel group the list of associated priorities and reliabilities, used as specified in TS 36.321 [6], in order of increasing logical channel group identity. If E-UTRAN includes logicalChGroupInfoList-v1530, it includes the same number of entries, and listed in the same order, as in logicalChGroupInfoList–r14, and a logical channel group identity of the same entry in logicalChGroupInfoList-r14 and in logicalChGroupInfo-v1530 is associated with both the priorties (as in logicalChGroupInfoList-r14) and reliablities (as in logicalChGroupInfoList-v-1520) of that entry. If logicalChGroupInfoList-v1530 is not included, this field indicates for each logical channel group the list of associated priorties.

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (mcs): Indicates the MCS as defined in TS 36.213 [23], clause 14.2.1. If not configured, the selection of MCS is up to UE implementation. If included, mcs-r14 corresponds to the MCS table in Table 8.6.1-1 with 64QAM indices overridden by 16QAM used for transmission on PSSCH. If included, mcs-r15 corresponds to both the MCS table in Table 8.6.1-1 in TS 36.213 [23] and the MCS table supporting 64QAM in Table 14.1.1-2 in TS 36.213 [23] used for transmission on PSSCH. If this field is present, E-UTRAN shall configure both mcs-r14 and mcs-r15.

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (ue-Selected): Indicates the configuration for the case the UE selects the transmission resources from a pool of resources configured by E-UTRAN.
ue-Selected in chapter5

In SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfigList section description: The IE SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfigList specifies the configuration information for carrier selection for V2X sidelink communication transmission using UE autonomous resource selection.

In SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig section description: The IE SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig specifies the configuration information for sidelink packet duplication for V2X sidelink communication transmission.

In SL-V2X-SyncFreqList section description: The IE SL-V2X-SyncFreqList specifies the list of candidate synchronisation carrier frequencies used for V2X sidelink communication.
syncFreqList in chapter5

In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated field description (slss-TxDisabled): Value TRUE indicates that the primary carrier, even though equipped with synchronisation resources, cannot be used as a synchronisation carrier frequency to transmit SLSS or PSBCH.
slss-TxDisabled in chapter5
LogicalChGroupInfoList-v1530: In SL-Reliability section description: The IE SL-Reliability indicates one or more reliabilities of a logical channel group used in case of scheduled sidelink communication resources or traffic reliability(ies) associated with the reported traffic pattern for V2X sidelink communication; see TS 36.321 [6].
SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfigList-r15: In SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfigList section description: The IE SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfigList specifies the configuration information for carrier selection for V2X sidelink communication transmission using UE autonomous resource selection.
SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfig-r15:
In SL-Priority section description: The IE SL-Priority indicates the one or more priorities of resource pool used for sidelink communication, or of a logical channel group used in case of scheduled sidelink communication resources, see TS 36.321 [6].

In SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfig field description (priorityList): Indicates the list of PPPP(s) which is associated with the configurations in threshCBR-FreqReselection and in threshCBR-FreqKeeping.
priorityList in chapter5

In SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfig field description (threshCBR-FreqReselection): Indicates the CBR threshold to determine whether the carrier frequency can be (re)selected for the transmission of V2X sidelink communication. See TS 36.321 [6].

In SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfig field description (threshCBR-FreqKeeping): Indicates the CBR threshold to determine whether the UE can keep using the carrier which was selected for the transmission of V2X sidelink communication. See TS 36.321 [6].
SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig-r15: In SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig section description: The IE SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig specifies the configuration information for sidelink packet duplication for V2X sidelink communication transmission.

In SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig field description (threshSL-Reliability): Indicates the reliability threshold used to determine whether sidelinik packet duplication is configured and activated for V2X sidelink communication transmission. See TS 36.323 [8] and TS 36.321 [6].
SL-PPPR-Dest-CarrierFreq: In SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig field description (allowedCarrierFreqList): Indicates, for V2X sidelink communication, the set of carrier frequencies applicable for the transmission of the MAC SDUs from the sidelink logical channels whose associated destination are included in destinationInfoList (see TS 36.321 [6]). If present, E-UTRAN shall ensure allowedCarrierFreqSet1 and allowedCarrierFreqSet2 do not include the same carrier frequency.
SL-AllowedCarrierFreqList-r15: In SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig field description (allowedCarrierFreqSet1): Indicates, for V2X sidelink communication, the set of carrier frequencies applicable for the transmission of the MAC SDUs from the sidelink logical channels whose associated destination are included in destinationInfoList (see TS 36.321 [6]). If present, E-UTRAN shall ensure allowedCarrierFreqSet1 and allowedCarrierFreqSet2 do not include the same carrier frequency.

In SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig field description (allowedCarrierFreqSet2): Indicates, for V2X sidelink communication, the set of carrier frequencies applicable for the transmission of the MAC SDUs from the sidelink logical channels whose associated destination are included in destinationInfoList (see TS 36.321 [6]). If present, E-UTRAN shall ensure allowedCarrierFreqSet1 and allowedCarrierFreqSet2 do not include the same carrier frequency.
SL-V2X-SyncFreqList-r15: In SL-V2X-SyncFreqList section description: The IE SL-V2X-SyncFreqList specifies the list of candidate synchronisation carrier frequencies used for V2X sidelink communication.
SL-ZoneConfig-r14: In SL-ZoneConfig section description: The IE SL-ZoneConfig indicates zone configurations used for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-ZoneConfig field description (zoneLength): Indicates the length of each geographic zone. Value m5 corresponds to 5 meters, m10 corresponds to 10 meters and so on.
zoneLength in chapter5
ENUMERATED {m5, m10, m20, m50, m100, m200, m500, spare1}

In SL-ZoneConfig field description (zoneWidth): Indicates the width of each geographic zone. Value m5 corresponds to 5 meters, m10 corresponds to 10 meters and so on.

SBCCH-SL-BCH-Message-V2X-r14: In SBCCH-SL-BCH-Message-V2X section description: The SBCCH-SL-BCH-Message-V2X class is the set of RRC messages that may be sent from the UE to the UE via SL-BCH on the SBCCH logical channel for V2X sidelink communication.

In MasterInformationBlock-NB field description (systemFrameNumber-MSB): Defines the 4 most significant bits of the SFN. As indicated in TS 36.211 [21], the 6 least significant bits of the SFN are acquired implicitly by decoding the NPBCH.
In MasterInformationBlock-NB field description (hyperSFN-LSB): Indicates the 2 least significant bits of hyper SFN. The remaining bits are present in SystemInformationBlockType1-NB.

In MasterInformationBlock-NB field description (schedulingInfoSIB1): This field contains an index to a table specified in TS 36.213 [23], Table 16.4.1.3-3, that defines SystemInformationBlockType1-NB scheduling information.
schedulingInfoSIB1 in chapter5

In MasterInformationBlock-NB field description (systemInfoValueTag): Common for all SIBs other than MIB-NB, SIB14-NB and SIB16-NB.
systemInfoValueTag in chapter5

In MasterInformationBlock-NB field description (ab-Enabled): Value TRUE indicates that access barring is enabled for UEs connected to EPC.
ab-Enabled in chapter5

In MasterInformationBlock-NB field description (operationModeInfo): Deployment scenario (in-band/guard-band/standalone) and related information. See TS 36.211 [21] and TS 36.213 [23].
Inband-SamePCI indicates an in-band deployment and that the NB-IoT and LTE cell share the same physical cell id and have the same number of NRS and CRS ports.
Inband-DifferentPCI indicates an in-band deployment and that the NB-IoT and LTE cell have different physical cell id.
guardband indicates a guard-band deployment.
standalone indicates a standalone deployment.
operationModeInfo in chapter5

In MasterInformationBlock-NB field description (additionalTransmissionSIB1): Value TRUE indicates that additional SIB1-NB transmissions are present. See TS 36.211 [21] and TS 36.213 [23].
E-UTRAN only configures additionalTransmissionSIB1 to TRUE if schedulingInfoSIB1 indicates that the number of NPDSCH repetitions is 16, see TS 36.213 [23], Table 16.4.1.3-3.

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.137 additionalTransmissionSIB1-r15
This field defines whether the UE supports additional SIB1 transmission in subframe #3 for FDD, as defined in TS 36.213 [22]. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB.

In MasterInformationBlock-NB field description (ab-Enabled-5GC): Value TRUE indicates that access barring is enabled for UEs connected to 5GC.

In MasterInformationBlock-NB field description (eutra-CRS-SequenceInfo): Information of the carrier containing NPSS/NSSS/NPBCH.
Each value is associated with an E-UTRA PRB index as an offset from the middle of the LTE system sorted out by channel raster offset. See TS 36.211[21] and TS 36.213 [23].
Inband-DifferentPCI-NB-r13: In MasterInformationBlock-NB field description (eutra-NumCRS-Ports): Number of E-UTRA CRS antenna ports, either the same number of ports as NRS or 4 antenna ports. See TS 36.211 [21], TS 36.212 [22], and TS 36.213 [23].

In ChannelRasterOffset-NB section description: The IE ChannelRasterOffset-NB is used to specify the NB-IoT offset from LTE channel raster. Unit in kHz in set { -7.5, -2.5, 2.5, 7.5} See TS 36.211[21] and TS 36.213 [23].

In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (hyperSFN-LSB): Indicates the 2 least significant bits of hyper SFN. The remaining bits are present in SystemInformationBlockType1-NB.

In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (schedulingInfoSIB1): This field contains an index to a table specified in TS 36.213 [23], Table 16.4.1.3-5 or Table 16.4.1.3-7 when sib1-CarrierInfo is set to anchor or to non-anchor respectively, that defines SystemInformationBlockType1-NB scheduling information.

In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (ab-Enabled): Value TRUE indicates that access barring is enabled for UEs connected to EPC.
ab-Enabled in chapter5

In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (operationModeInfo): Deployment scenario (in-band/guard-band/standalone) and related information. See TS 36.211 [21] and TS 36.213 [23].
Inband-SamePCI indicates an in-band deployment and that the NB-IoT and LTE cell share the same physical cell id and have the same number of NRS and CRS ports.
Inband-DifferentPCI indicates an in-band deployment and that the NB-IoT and LTE cell have different physical cell id.
guardband indicates a guard-band deployment.
standalone indicates a standalone deployment.
When operationmodeInfo is set to guardband, if rasterOffset is set to khz-7dot5 or khz-2dot5, the guardband anchor carrier is at the higher edge of the LTE carrier. If rasterOffset is set to khz7dot5 or khz2dot5, the guardband anchor carrier is at the lower edge of the LTE carrier
operationModeInfo in chapter5

In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (sib1-CarrierInfo): Carrier used for SIB1 transmission. See TS 36.213 [23], clause 16.4.1.3. Value anchor corresponds to anchor carrier, value non-anchor corresponds to non-anchor carrier.

In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (ab-Enabled-5GC): Value TRUE indicates that access barring is enabled for UEs connected to 5GC.
ab-Enabled-5GC in chapter5
GuardbandTDD-NB-r15: In ChannelRasterOffset-NB section description: The IE ChannelRasterOffset-NB is used to specify the NB-IoT offset from LTE channel raster. Unit in kHz in set { -7.5, -2.5, 2.5, 7.5} See TS 36.211[21] and TS 36.213 [23].

In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (sib-GuardbandInfo): Information of the carrier used for SIB1 and/or SI transmission when operationmodeInfo is set to guardband. See TS 36.213 [23].
sib-GuardbandAnchor indicates the anchor carrier.
sib-GuardbandGuardband indicates a non-anchor carrier in guardband mode.
sib-GuardbandInbandSamePCI or sib-GuardbandinbandDiffPCI indicates a non-anchor carrier in inband mode, and at the edge of the LTE carrier and on the same side as the anchor carrier.
Inband-SamePCI-TDD-NB-r15:
In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (eutra-CRS-SequenceInfo): Information of the carrier containing NPSS/NSSS/NPBCH.
Each value is associated with an E-UTRA PRB index as an offset from the middle of the LTE system sorted out by channel raster offset. See TS 36.211 [21] and TS 36.213 [23].

In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (sib-InbandLocation): Location of the non-anchor carrier used for SIB1 and/or SI transmission when operationmodeInfo is set to inband-SamePCI or inband-DifferentPCI, and sib1-CarrierInfo value and/or tdd-SI-CarrierInfo in SIB1-NB is set to non-anchor. See TS 36.213 [23].
Value lower corresponds to the lower adjacent carrier relative to the anchor carrier and value higher corresponds to the higher adjacent carrier relative to the anchor carrier.
If both sib1-CarrierInfo value and tdd-SI-CarrierInfo value in SIB1-NB are set to anchor, the UE ignores sib-InbandLocation.
Inband-DifferentPCI-TDD-NB-r15: In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (eutra-NumCRS-Ports): Number of E-UTRA CRS antenna ports, either the same number of ports as NRS or 4 antenna ports. See TS 36.211 [21], TS 36.212 [22], and TS 36.213 [23].

In ChannelRasterOffset-NB section description: The IE ChannelRasterOffset-NB is used to specify the NB-IoT offset from LTE channel raster. Unit in kHz in set { -7.5, -2.5, 2.5, 7.5} See TS 36.211[21] and TS 36.213 [23].

In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (sib-InbandLocation): Location of the non-anchor carrier used for SIB1 and/or SI transmission when operationmodeInfo is set to inband-SamePCI or inband-DifferentPCI, and sib1-CarrierInfo value and/or tdd-SI-CarrierInfo in SIB1-NB is set to non-anchor. See TS 36.213 [23].
Value lower corresponds to the lower adjacent carrier relative to the anchor carrier and value higher corresponds to the higher adjacent carrier relative to the anchor carrier.
If both sib1-CarrierInfo value and tdd-SI-CarrierInfo value in SIB1-NB are set to anchor, the UE ignores sib-InbandLocation.
StandaloneTDD-NB-r15:
In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (sib-StandaloneLocation): Location of the non-anchor carrier used for SIB1 and/or SI transmission when operationmodeInfo is set to standalone, and sib1-CarrierInfo value and/or tdd-SI-CarrierInfo in SIB1-NB is set to non-anchor. See TS 36.213 [23].
Value lower corresponds to the lower adjacent carrier relative to the anchor carrier and value higher corresponds to the higher adjacent carrier relative to the anchor carrier.
If both sib1-CarrierInfo value and tdd-SI-CarrierInfo value in SIB1-NB are set to anchor, the UE ignores sib-StandaloneLocation.
SIB-GuardbandGuardbandTDD-NB-r15:
In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (sib-GuardbandGuardbandLocation): Location of the non-anchor carrier used for SIB1 and/or SI transmission when operationmodeInfo is set to guardband and the non-anchor carrier is in guardband. See TS 36.213 [23].
Value same corresponds to the carrier adjacent to the anchor carrier on the outer side of the guardband, value opposite corresponds to the carrier closest to the edge of the LTE carrier in the opposite guardband.
SIB-GuardbandInbandDiffPCI-TDD-NB-r15: In MasterInformationBlock-TDD-NB field description (sib-eutra-NumCRS-Ports): Number of E-UTRA CRS antenna ports, either the same number of ports as NRS or 4 antenna ports. See TS 36.211 [21], TS 36.212 [22], and TS 36.213 [23].

RRCEarlyDataComplete-NB-r15:
In RRCEarlyDataComplete-NB section description: The RRCEarlyDataComplete-NB message is used to confirm the successful completion of the CP-EDT procedure.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB0
RLC-SAP: TM
Logical channel: CCCH
Direction: E-UTRAN to UE
RRCEarlyDataComplete-NB-r15-IEs:
In DedicatedInfoNAS section description: The IE DedicatedInfoNAS is used to transfer UE specific NAS layer information between the network and the UE. The RRC layer is transparent for this information.
dedicatedInfoNAS in chapter5

In RRCEarlyDataComplete-NB field description (extendedWaitTime): Value in seconds.
extendedWaitTime in chapter5
Cond Redirection: In RRCEarlyDataComplete-NB: The field is optionally present, Need ON, if redirectedCarrierInfo is included; otherwise the field is not present.
RRCEarlyDataRequest-NB-r15:
In RRCEarlyDataRequest-NB section description: The RRCEarlyDataRequest-NB message is used to initiate CP-EDT.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB0
RLC-SAP: TM
Logical channel: CCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN
RRCEarlyDataRequest-NB-r15-IEs:
In S-TMSI section description: The IE S-TMSI contains an S-Temporary Mobile Subscriber Identity, a temporary UE identity provided by the EPC which uniquely identifies the UE within the tracking area, see TS 23.003 [27].
s-TMSI in chapter5

In RRCEarlyDataRequest-NB field description (establishmentCause): Provides the establishment cause for the RRC early data request as provided by the upper layers.
eNB is not expected to reject a RRCEarlyDataRequest due to unknown cause value being used by the UE.
establishmentCause in chapter5

ENUMERATED {noMeasurements, candidateRep-A, candidateRep-B, candidateRep-C, candidateRep-D, candidateRep-E, candidateRep-F, candidateRep-G, candidateRep-H, candidateRep-I, candidateRep-J, candidateRep-K, candidateRep-L}

In CQI-NPDCCH-NB section description: The IE CQI-NPDCCH-NB represents the downlink channel quality measurement of the NB-IoT carrier where the random access response is received. The codepoints for the CQI-NPDCCH measurements are according to the mapping table in TS 36.133 [16]. The value noMeasurements indicates no measurement reporting.
cqi-NPDCCH in chapter5

In DedicatedInfoNAS section description: The IE DedicatedInfoNAS is used to transfer UE specific NAS layer information between the network and the UE. The RRC layer is transparent for this information.
dedicatedInfoNAS in chapter5
RRCEarlyDataRequest-5GC-NB-r16-IEs:
In NG-5G-S-TMSI section description: The IE NG-5G-S-TMSI contains a 5G S-Temporary Mobile Subscriber Identity, a temporary UE identity provided by the AMF which uniquely identifies the UE within the tracking area, see TS 23.003 [27].
ng-5G-S-TMSI in chapter5

In RRCEarlyDataRequest-NB field description (establishmentCause): Provides the establishment cause for the RRC early data request as provided by the upper layers.
eNB is not expected to reject a RRCEarlyDataRequest due to unknown cause value being used by the UE.
establishmentCause in chapter5

ENUMERATED {noMeasurements, candidateRep-A, candidateRep-B, candidateRep-C, candidateRep-D, candidateRep-E, candidateRep-F, candidateRep-G, candidateRep-H, candidateRep-I, candidateRep-J, candidateRep-K, candidateRep-L}

In CQI-NPDCCH-NB section description: The IE CQI-NPDCCH-NB represents the downlink channel quality measurement of the NB-IoT carrier where the random access response is received. The codepoints for the CQI-NPDCCH measurements are according to the mapping table in TS 36.133 [16]. The value noMeasurements indicates no measurement reporting.
cqi-NPDCCH in chapter5

In DedicatedInfoNAS section description: The IE DedicatedInfoNAS is used to transfer UE specific NAS layer information between the network and the UE. The RRC layer is transparent for this information.
dedicatedInfoNAS in chapter5
SCPTMConfiguration-NB-r14:
In SCPTMConfiguration-NB section description: The SCPTMConfiguration-NB message contains the control information applicable for MBMS services transmitted via SC-MRB.
Signalling radio bearer: N/A
RLC-SAP: UM
Logical channel: SC-MCCH
Direction: E-UTRAN to UE

In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB section description: The IE SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB provides the list of ongoing MBMS sessions transmitted via SC-MRB and for each MBMS session, the associated G-RNTI and scheduling information.

In SCPTMConfiguration-NB field description (sc-mtch-InfoList): Provides the configuration of each SC-MTCH not using multiple TB scheduling in the current cell.
sc-mtch-InfoList in chapter5

In SCPTM-NeighbourCellList-NB section description: The IE SCPTM-NeighbourCellList-NB indicates a list of neighbour cells where ongoing MBMS sessions provided via SC-MRB in the current cells are also provided.

In SCPTMConfiguration-NB field description (scptm-NeighbourCellList): List of neighbour cells providing MBMS services via SC-MRB. When absent, the UE shall assume that MBMS services listed in the SCPTMConfiguration-NB message are not provided via SC-MRB in any neighbour cell.
SCPTMConfiguration-NB-v16xy:
In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB section description: The IE SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB provides the list of ongoing MBMS sessions transmitted via SC-MRB and for each MBMS session, the associated G-RNTI and scheduling information.

In SCPTMConfiguration-NB field description (sc-mtch-InfoListMultiTB): Provides the configuration of each SC-MTCH using multiple TB scheduling in the current cell.
The total number of signalled SC-MTCH configuration in sc-mtch-InfoList and sc-mtch-InfoListMultiTB cannot be more than maxSC-MTCH-NB-r14.

In SCPTMConfiguration-NB field description (multiTB-Gap): Indicates the scheduling gap for SC-MTCH using multiple TB scheduling, see TS 36.211 [21] and TS 36.213 [23]. Value sf16 corresponds to 16 subframes, sf32 corresponds to 32 subframes, and so on. If the field is absent, there is no scheduling gap.
SystemInformation-NB:
In SystemInformation-NB section description: The SystemInformation-NB message is used to convey one or more System Information Blocks. All the SIBs included are transmitted with the same periodicity.
Signalling radio bearer: N/A
RLC-SAP: TM
Logical channel: BCCH
Direction: E-UTRAN to UE
SystemInformation-NB-r13-IEs:
In SystemInformationBlockType2-NB section description: The IE SystemInformationBlockType2-NB contains radio resource configuration information that is common for all UEs.
NOTE: UE timers and constants related to functionality for which parameters are provided in another SIB are included in the corresponding SIB.

In SystemInformationBlockType3-NB section description: The IE SystemInformationBlockType3-NB contains cell re-selection information common for intra-frequency, and inter-frequency cell re-selection as well as intra-frequency cell re-selection information other than neighbouring cell related.

In SystemInformationBlockType4-NB section description: The IE SystemInformationBlockType4-NB contains neighbouring cell related information relevant only for intra-frequency cell re-selection. The IE includes cells with specific re-selection parameters.

In SystemInformationBlockType5-NB section description: The IE SystemInformationBlockType5-NB contains information relevant only for inter-frequency cell re-selection i.e. information about other NB-IoT frequencies and inter-frequency neighbouring cells relevant for cell re-selection. The IE includes cell re-selection parameters common for a frequency as well as cell specific re-selection parameters.
In SystemInformationBlockType14-NB section description: The IE SystemInformationBlockType14-NB contains the AB parameters for EPC and 5GC.

In SystemInformationBlockType16-NB section description: The IE SystemInformationBlockType16-NB contains information related to GPS time and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The UE may use the parameters provided in this system information block to obtain the UTC, the GPS and the local time.
In SystemInformationBlockType15-NB section description: The IE SystemInformationBlockType15-NB contains the MBMS Service Area Identities (SAI) of the current and/ or neighbouring carrier frequencies.

In SystemInformationBlockType20-NB section description: For FDD, the IE SystemInformationBlockType20-NB contains the information required to acquire the control information associated with transmission of MBMS using SC-PTM.
In SystemInformationBlockType22-NB section description: The IE SystemInformationBlockType22-NB contains radio resource configuration for paging and random access procedure on non-anchor carriers.

In SystemInformationBlockType23-NB section description: For FDD, the IE SystemInformationBlockType23-NB contains radio resource configuration for NPRACH resources using preamble format 2 on non-anchor carriers.

In SystemInformationBlockType27-NB section description: The IE SystemInformationBlockType27-NB contains assistance information relevant only for inter-RAT cell selection i.e. assistance information about E-UTRA frequencies and/ or GERAN frequencies for cell selection.
SystemInformationBlockType1-NB:
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB section description: The SystemInformationBlockType1-NB message contains information relevant when evaluating if a UE is allowed to access a cell and defines the scheduling of other system information.
Signalling radio bearer: N/A
RLC-SAP: TM
Logical channel: BCCH
Direction: E-UTRAN to UE
SystemInformationBlockType1-NB in chapter5

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (hyperSFN-MSB): Indicates the 8 most significant bits of hyper-SFN. Together with hyperSFN-LSB in MIB-NB, the complete hyper-SFN is built up. hyper-SFN is incremented by one when the SFN wraps around.
hyperSFN-MSB in chapter5

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (plmn-IdentityList): List of PLMN identities. The first listed PLMN-Identity is the primary PLMN.
plmn-IdentityList in chapter5

In TrackingAreaCode section description: The IE TrackingAreaCode is used to identify a tracking area within the scope of a PLMN, see TS 24.301 [35].

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (trackingAreaCode): A trackingAreaCode that is common for all the PLMNs listed.
trackingAreaCode in chapter5

In CellIdentity section description: The IE CellIdentity is used to unambiguously identify a cell within a PLMN.

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (cellIdentity): Indicates the cell identity.
If the field is absent in cellAccessRelatedInfo-5GC, the cell identity indicated by the cellIdentity field included in cellAccessRelatedInfo for EPC is used when connected to 5GC.
cellIdentity in chapter5
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (cellBarred): Barred means the cell is barred for connectivity to EPC, as defined in TS 36.304 [4].

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (intraFreqReselection): Used to control cell reselection to intra-frequency cells when the highest ranked cell is barred, or treated as barred by the UE, as specified in TS 36.304 [4].
intraFreqReselection in chapter5
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (cellSelectionInfo): Cell selection information as specified in TS 36.304 [4].

In Q-RxLevMin section description: The IE Q-RxLevMin is used to indicate for cell selection/ re-selection the required minimum received RSRP level in the (E-UTRA) cell. Corresponds to parameter Qrxlevmin in TS 36.304 [4]. Actual value Qrxlevmin = field value * 2 [dBm].

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (q-RxLevMin): Parameter Qrxlevmin in TS 36.304 [4]. If delta-RxLevMin is not included, actual value Qrxlevmin = q-RxLevMin * 2 [dBm]. If delta-RxLevMin is included, actual value Qrxlevmin = (q-RxLevMin + delta-RxLevMin) * 2 [dBm].
q-RxLevMin in chapter5

In Q-QualMin section description: The IE Q-QualMin is used to indicate for cell selection/ re-selection the required minimum received RSRQ level in the (E-UTRA) cell. Corresponds to parameter Qqualmin in TS 36.304 [4]. Actual value Qqualmin = field value [dB].

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (q-QualMin): Parameter "Qqualmin" in TS 36.304 [4].

In P-Max section description: The IE P-Max is used to limit the UE's uplink transmission power on a carrier frequency and is used to calculate the parameter Pcompensation defined in TS 36.304 [4]. Corresponds to parameter PEMAX or PEMAX,c in TS 36.101 [42]. The UE transmit power on one serving cell shall not exceed the configured maximum UE output power of the serving cell determined by this value as specified in TS 36.101 [42], clauses 6.2.5 or 6.2.5A, or, when transmitting sidelink discovery announcements within the coverage of the concerned cell, as specified in TS 36.101 [42], clause 6.2.5D.

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (p-Max): Value applicable for the cell. If absent the UE applies the maximum power according to the UE capability.
p-Max in chapter5

In FreqBandIndicator-NB section description: The IE FreqBandIndicator-NB indicates the E-UTRA operating band as defined in TS 36.101 [42], table 5.5-1.
freqBandIndicator in chapter5

In NS-PmaxList-NB section description: The IE NS-PmaxList-NB concerns a list of additionalPmax and additionalSpectrumEmission as defined in TS 36.101 [42], clause 6.2.4F, for a given frequency band. E-UTRAN does not include the same value of additionalSpectrumEmission in SystemInformationBlockType2-NB within this list.

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (freqBandInfo): A list of additionalPmax and additionalSpectrumEmission values as defined in TS 36.101 [42], clause 6.2.4F for the frequency band in freqBandIndicator.
freqBandInfo in chapter5

In MultiBandInfoList-NB section description:

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (multiBandInfoList): A list of additional frequency band indicators, additionalPmax and additionalSpectrumEmission values, as defined in TS 36.101 [42], table 5.5-1. If the UE supports the frequency band in the freqBandIndicator IE it shall apply that frequency band. Otherwise, the UE shall apply the first listed band which it supports in the multiBandInfoList IE.
multiBandInfoList in chapter5

Cond SIB1: In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB: The field is mandatory present if IE additionalTransmissionSIB1 in MIB-NB is set to TRUE. Otherwise the field is optionally present, Need OP.
In DL-Bitmap-NB section description: The IE DL-Bitmap-NB is used to specify the set of NB-IoT downlink subframes for downlink transmission.

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (downlinkBitmap): For FDD, NB-IoT downlink subframe configuration for downlink transmission as specified in TS 36.213 [23], clause 16.4.
For TDD, NB-IoT downlink, uplink and special subframes configuration for transmission on the anchor carrier as specified in TS 36.213 [23], clause 16.4. If the bitmap is not present, the UE shall assume that all subframes are valid (except for subframes carrying NPSS/NSSS/NPBCH/SIB1-NB) as specified in TS 36.213 [23], clause 16.4.
downlinkBitmap in chapter5

Cond inband: In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB: In FDD: The field is mandatory present if IE operationModeInfo in MIB-NB is set to inband-SamePCI or inband-DifferentPCI. Otherwise the field is not present.
In TDD: The field is mandatory present if:
- IE operationModeInfo in MIB-TDD-NB is set to inband-SamePCI or inband-DifferentPCI or
- IE operationModeInfo in MIB-TDD-NB is set to guardband and IE sib-GuardbandInfo in MIB-TDD-NB is set to sib-GuardbandInbandSamePCI or sib-GuardbandinbandDiffPCI and IE tdd-SI-CarrierInfo is set to non-anchor
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (eutraControlRegionSize): Indicates the control region size of the E-UTRA cell for the in-band operation mode, see TS 36.213 [23]. Unit is in number of OFDM symbols.
ENUMERATED {dB-6, dB-4dot77, dB-3, dB-1dot77, dB0, dB1, dB1dot23, dB2, dB3, dB4, dB4dot23, dB5, dB6, dB7, dB8, dB9}

Cond inband-SamePCI: In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB: The field is mandatory present, if IE operationModeInfo in MIB-NB is set to inband-SamePCI. Otherwise the field is not present.
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (nrs-CRS-PowerOffset): NRS power offset between NRS and E-UTRA CRS, see TS 36.213 [23], clause 16.2.2. Unit in dB. Default value of 0.

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (schedulingInfoList): Indicates additional scheduling information of SI messages.
schedulingInfoList in chapter5
ENUMERATED {ms160, ms320, ms480, ms640, ms960, ms1280, ms1600, spare1}

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (si-WindowLength): Common SI scheduling window for all SIs. Unit in milliseconds, where ms160 denotes 160 milliseconds, ms320 denotes 320 milliseconds and so on.
si-WindowLength in chapter5

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (si-RadioFrameOffset): Offset in number of radio frames to calculate the start of the SI window.
If the field is absent, no offset is applied.
si-RadioFrameOffset in chapter5

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (systemInfoValueTagList): Indicates SI message specific value tags. It includes the same number of entries, and listed in the same order, as in SchedulingInfoList.
SystemInformationBlockType1-NB-v1350:
Cond Qrxlevmin: In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB: This field is optionally present, Need OR, if q-RxLevMin is set to the minimum value. Otherwise the field is not present.
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (cellSelectionInfo): Cell selection information as specified in TS 36.304 [4].
SystemInformationBlockType1-NB-v1430: In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (cellSelectionInfo): Cell selection information as specified in TS 36.304 [4].
SystemInformationBlockType1-NB-v1450: ENUMERATED {dB-6, dB-4dot77, dB-3, dB-1dot77, dB0, dB1, dB1dot23, dB2, dB3, dB4, dB4dot23, dB5, dB6, dB7, dB8, dB9}

Cond inband-SamePCI-ExceptAnchor: In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB: The field is optionally present if IE operationModeInfo in MIB-NB is set to a value other than inband-SamePCI, and at least one non-anchor carrier is inband carrier and uses the same PCI as the E-UTRA carrier. Otherwise the field is not present.
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (nrs-CRS-PowerOffset): NRS power offset between NRS and E-UTRA CRS, see TS 36.213 [23], clause 16.2.2. Unit in dB. Default value of 0.
SystemInformationBlockType1-NB-v1530: Cond TDD: In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB: The field is mandatory present for TDD; otherwise the field is not present and the UE shall delete any existing value for this field.

In TDD-Config-NB section description: The IE TDD-Config-NB is used to specify the TDD specific physical channel configuration.
TDD-Config information element

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (tdd-Config): Indicates the the TDD specific physical channel configuration.
tdd-Config in chapter5

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (tdd-SI-CarrierInfo): Carrier used for SI message transmission. Value anchor corresponds to anchor carrier, value non-anchor corresponds to non-anchor carrier. See TS 36.213 [23].
When tdd-SI-CarrierInfo set to value non-anchor then sib-GuardbandInfo in MIB-TDD-NB (in case of operationmodeInfo is set to guardband) or sib-InbandLocation in MIB-TDD-NB (in case of operationmodeInfo is set to inband-SamePCI or inband-DifferentPCI) or sib-StandaloneLocation in MIB-TDD-NB (in case of operationmodeInfo is set to standalone) defines which non-anchor carrier is used (see MIB-NB-TDD).

Cond TDD-SI-NonAnchor: In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB: The field is mandatory present for TDD if si-CarrierInfo is set to non-anchor; otherwise the field is not present and the UE shall delete any existing value for this field.
In DL-Bitmap-NB section description: The IE DL-Bitmap-NB is used to specify the set of NB-IoT downlink subframes for downlink transmission.

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (tdd-SI-SubframesBitmap): NB-IoT downlink, uplink and special subframes configuration for transmission on the carrier carrying the SI message as specified in TS 36.213 [23], clause 16.4.

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (schedulingInfoList): Indicates additional scheduling information of SI messages.
schedulingInfoList in chapter5
SystemInformationBlockType1-NB-v16xy:
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (plmn-IdentityList): List of PLMN identities. The first listed PLMN-Identity is the primary PLMN.
plmn-IdentityList in chapter5
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (trackingAreaCode-5GC): A trackingAreaCode that is common for all the PLMNs listed.

In CellIdentity section description: The IE CellIdentity is used to unambiguously identify a cell within a PLMN.

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (cellIdentity): Indicates the cell identity.
If the field is absent in cellAccessRelatedInfo-5GC, the cell identity indicated by the cellIdentity field included in cellAccessRelatedInfo for EPC is used when connected to 5GC.
cellIdentity in chapter5
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (cellBarred-5GC): Barred means the cell is barred for connectivity to 5GC, as defined in TS 36.304 [4].
PLMN-IdentityInfo-NB-r13:
In PLMN-Identity section description: The IE PLMN-Identity identifies a Public Land Mobile Network. Further information regarding how to set the IE are specified in TS 23.003 [27].
plmn-Identity in chapter5
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (cellReservedForOperatorUse): As defined in TS 36.304 [4].

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (attachWithoutPDN-Connectivity): If present, the field indicates that attach without PDN connectivity as specified in TS 24.301 [35] is supported for this PLMN.
attachWithoutPDN-Connectivity in chapter5
PLMN-IdentityInfo-5GC-NB-r16:
In PLMN-Identity section description: The IE PLMN-Identity identifies a Public Land Mobile Network. Further information regarding how to set the IE are specified in TS 23.003 [27].
plmn-Identity in chapter5

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (plmn-Index): Index of the PLMN in the plmn-IdentityList field included in cellAccessRelatedInfo for EPC, indicating the same PLMN ID is used when connected to 5GC.
plmn-Index in chapter5
In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (cellReservedForOperatorUse): As defined in TS 36.304 [4].

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (ng-U-DataTransfer): If present, the field indicates that the NG-U data transfer as specified in TS 24.501 [95] is supported.
ng-U-DataTransfer in chapter5

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (up-CIoT-5GS-Optimisation): This field indicates if the UE is allowed to resume the connection with User plane CIoT 5GS Optimisation, see TS24.501 [95].
up-CIoT-5GS-Optimisation in chapter5
SchedulingInfo-NB-r13: ENUMERATED {rf64, rf128, rf256, rf512, rf1024, rf2048, rf4096, spare}

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (si-Periodicity): Periodicity of the SI-message in radio frames, such that rf256 denotes 256 radio frames, rf512 denotes 512 radio frames, and so on.
si-Periodicity in chapter5

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (si-RepetitionPattern): Indicates the starting radio frames within the SI window used for SI message transmission. Value every2ndRF corresponds to every 2 radio frames, value every4thRF corresponds to every 4 radio frames and so on. The first transmission of the SI message is transmitted from the first radio frame of the SI window.
si-RepetitionPattern in chapter5

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (sib-MappingInfo): List of the SIBs mapped to this SystemInformation message. There is no mapping information of SIB2-NB; it is always present in the first SystemInformation message listed in the schedulingInfoList list.

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (si-TB): This field indicates the transport block size in number of bits and the corresponding number of consecutive NB-IoT downlink subframes that are used to broadcast the SI message. Value b56 corresponds to 56 bits, b120 corresponds to 120 bits and so on. TBS of 56 bits and 120 bits are transmitted over 2 sub-frames, other TBS are transmitted over 8 sub-frames, see TS 36.213 [23], Table 16.4.1.5.1-1.
SchedulingInfo-NB-v1530: In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (sib-MappingInfo): List of the SIBs mapped to this SystemInformation message. There is no mapping information of SIB2-NB; it is always present in the first SystemInformation message listed in the schedulingInfoList list.
SIB-MappingInfo-NB-r13: ENUMERATED {sibType3-NB-r13, sibType4-NB-r13, sibType5-NB-r13, sibType14-NB-r13, sibType16-NB-r13, sibType15-NB-r14, sibType20-NB-r14, sibType22-NB-r14}
SIB-MappingInfo-NB-v1530: ENUMERATED {sibType23-NB-r15, sibType27-NB-r16, spare6, spare5, spare4, spare3, spare2, spare1}
SIB-Type-NB-r13: ENUMERATED {sibType3-NB-r13, sibType4-NB-r13, sibType5-NB-r13, sibType14-NB-r13, sibType16-NB-r13, sibType15-NB-r14, sibType20-NB-r14, sibType22-NB-r14}
SIB-Type-NB-v1530: ENUMERATED {sibType23-NB-r15, sibType27-NB-r16, spare6, spare5, spare4, spare3, spare2, spare1}
CellSelectionInfo-NB-v1350: In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (delta-RxLevMin): Parameter Qrxlevmin in TS 36.304 [4]. If delta-RxLevMin is not included, actual value Qrxlevmin = q-RxLevMin * 2 [dBm]. If delta-RxLevMin is included, actual value Qrxlevmin = (q-RxLevMin + delta-RxLevMin) * 2 [dBm].
CellSelectionInfo-NB-v1430: ENUMERATED {dB-6, dB-3, dB3, dB6, dB9, dB12}

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (powerClass14dBm-Offset): Parameter "Poffset" in TS 36.304 [4]. Only applicable for UE supporting powerClassNB-14dBm. Value in dB. Value dB-6 corresponds to -6 dB, dB-3 corresponds to -3 dB and so on. If the fied is absent, the UE applies the (default) value of 0 dB for "Poffset" in TS 36.304 [4].
ENUMERATED {dB5, dB10, dB15, dB20, dB25, dB30, dB35}

In SystemInformationBlockType1-NB field description (ce-authorisationOffset): Parameter "Qoffsetauthorization" in TS 36.304 [4]. Value in dB. Value dB5 corresponds to 5 dB, dB10 corresponds to 10 dB and so on.
If the field is absent, the value of 0 dB shall be used for "Qoffsetauthorization".
UECapabilityEnquiry-NB:
In UECapabilityEnquiry-NB section description: The UECapabilityEnquiry-NB message is used to request the transfer of UE radio access capabilities for NB-IoT.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1 or SRB1bis
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: E-UTRAN to UE

In RRC-TransactionIdentifier section description: The IE RRC-TransactionIdentifier is used, together with the message type, for the identification of an RRC procedure (transaction).
rrc-TransactionIdentifier in chapter5
UECapabilityInformation-NB:
In UECapabilityInformation-NB section description: The UECapabilityInformation-NB message is used to transfer of UE radio access capabilities requested by the E-UTRAN.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1 or SRB1bis
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN

In RRC-TransactionIdentifier section description: The IE RRC-TransactionIdentifier is used, together with the message type, for the identification of an RRC procedure (transaction).
rrc-TransactionIdentifier in chapter5
UECapabilityInformation-NB-r13-IEs:
In UE-Capability-NB section description: The IE UE-Capability-NB is used to convey the NB-IoT UE Radio Access Capability Parameters, see TS 36.306 [5]. The IE UE-Capability-NB is transferred in NB-IoT only.
ue-Capability in chapter5

In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB section description: The IE UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB contains UE NB-IoT capability information needed for paging.

In UECapabilityInformation-NB field description (ue-RadioPagingInfo): This field contains UE capability information used for paging.
ue-RadioPagingInfo in chapter5
UEInformationRequest-NB-r16:
In UEInformationRequest-NB section description: The UEInformationRequest-NB is the command used by E-UTRAN to retrieve information from the UE.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1 or SRB1bis
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: E-UTRAN to UE

In RRC-TransactionIdentifier section description: The IE RRC-TransactionIdentifier is used, together with the message type, for the identification of an RRC procedure (transaction).
rrc-TransactionIdentifier in chapter5
UEInformationRequest-NB-r16-IEs:
In UEInformationRequest-NB field description (rach-ReportReq): This field is used to indicate whether the UE shall report, if available, information about the random access procedure.
rach-ReportReq in chapter5

In UEInformationRequest-NB field description (rlf-ReportReq): This field is used to indicate whether the UE shall report, if available, information about radio link failure.
rlf-ReportReq in chapter5

In UEInformationRequest-NB field description (anr-ReportReq): This field is used to indicate whether the UE shall report, if available, ANR measurement results.
anr-ReportReq in chapter5
UEInformationResponse-NB-r16:
In UEInformationResponse-NB section description: The UEInformationResponse-NB message is used by the UE to transfer the information requested by the E-UTRAN.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1 or SRB1bis
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN

In RRC-TransactionIdentifier section description: The IE RRC-TransactionIdentifier is used, together with the message type, for the identification of an RRC procedure (transaction).

In Q-QualMin section description: The IE Q-QualMin is used to indicate for cell selection/ re-selection the required minimum received RSRQ level in the (E-UTRA) cell. Corresponds to parameter Qqualmin in TS 36.304 [4]. Actual value Qqualmin = field value [dB].

In P-Max section description: The IE P-Max is used to limit the UE's uplink transmission power on a carrier frequency and is used to calculate the parameter Pcompensation defined in TS 36.304 [4]. Corresponds to parameter PEMAX or PEMAX,c in TS 36.101 [42]. The UE transmit power on one serving cell shall not exceed the configured maximum UE output power of the serving cell determined by this value as specified in TS 36.101 [42], clauses 6.2.5 or 6.2.5A, or, when transmitting sidelink discovery announcements within the coverage of the concerned cell, as specified in TS 36.101 [42], clause 6.2.5D.

In SystemInformationBlockType3-NB field description (p-Max): Value applicable for the intra-frequency neighbouring E-UTRA cells. If absent the UE applies the maximum power according to the UE capability.
