In NPRACH-ConfigSIB-NB field description (npdcch-CarrierIndex): For FDD: Index of the carrier in the list of DL non anchor carriers. The first entry in the list has index '1', the second entry has index '2' and so on.
If the UE supports mixed operation mode and dl-ConfigListMixed is present in systemInformationBlockType22-NB, the UE creates a combined list of DL carriers for random access by appending dl-ConfigListMixed to the dl-ConfigList while maintaining the order among both dl-ConfigList and dl-ConfigListMixed; only the first maxNonAnchorCarriers-NB-r14 DL non-anchor carriers in the concatenated list can be used for random access.
If the field is absent in the entry in nprach-ParametersListEDT in SystemInformationBlockType22-NB, the value of npdcch-CarrierIndex in the corresponding entry of nprach-ParametersList applies, if present. If the field is absent in an entry in nprach-ParametersListFmt2EDT in SystemInformationBlockType23-NB, the value of npdcch-CarrierIndex in the corresponding entry of nprach-ParametersListFmt2 applies, if present. Otherwise, the DL anchor carrier is used.
For TDD: This parameter is absent and the same carrier is used in uplink and downlink.
RSRP-ThresholdsNPRACH-InfoList-NB-r13: In RSRP-Range section description: The IE RSRP-Range specifies the value range used in RSRP measurements and thresholds. Integer value for RSRP measurements according to mapping table in TS 36.133 [16]. A given field using RSRP-Range-v1360 shall only be signalled if the corresponding original field (using RSRP-Range i.e. without suffix) is set to value 0.
EDT-TBS-NB-r15: In NPRACH-ConfigSIB-NB field description (edt-SmallTBS-Enabled): Value TRUE indicates UE performing EDT is allowed to select TBS smaller than edt-TBS for Msg3 according to the corresponding NPRACH resource, as specified in TS 36.213 [23].

In NPRACH-ConfigSIB-NB field description (edt-TBS): Largest TBS for Msg3 for a NPRACH resource applicable to a UE performing EDT. Value in bits. Value b328 corresponds to 328 bits, value b408 corresponds to 408 bits and so on. See TS 36.213 [23].
edt-TBS in chapter5
NPUSCH-ConfigCommon-NB-r13: In NPUSCH-Config-NB section description: The IE NPUSCH-ConfigCommon-NB is used to specify the common NPUSCH configuration. The IE NPUSCH-ConfigDedicated-NB is used to specify the UE specific NPUSCH configuration.

In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (ack-NACK-NumRepetitions-Msg4): Number of repetitions for ACK/NACK HARQ response to NPDSCH containing Msg4 per NPRACH resource, see TS 36.213 [23], clause 16.4.2.
ENUMERATED {r1, r2, r4, r8, r16, r32, r64, r128}
ENUMERATED {sc0, sc1, sc2, sc3, sc4, sc5, sc6, sc7, sc8, sc9, sc10, sc11, sc12, sc13, sc14, sc15}
In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (srs-SubframeConfig): SRS SubframeConfiguration. See TS 36.211 [21], table 5.5.3.3-1. Value sc0 corresponds to value 0, sc1 to value 1 and so on.

In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (threeTone-BaseSequence): The base sequence of DMRS sequence in a cell for 3 tones transmission; see TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.1.4.1.2. If absent, it is given by NB-IoT CellID mod 12. Value 12 is not used.
In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (threeTone-CyclicShift): Define 3 cyclic shifts for the 3-tone case, see TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.1.4.1.2.

In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (sixTone-BaseSequence): The base sequence of DMRS sequence in a cell for 6 tones transmission; see TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.1.4.1.2. If absent, it is given by NB-IoT CellID mod 14. Value 14 is not used.
In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (sixTone-CyclicShift): Define 4 cyclic shifts for the 6-tone case, see TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.1.4.1.2.

In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (twelveTone-BaseSequence): The base sequence of DMRS sequence in a cell for 12 tones transmission; see TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.1.4.1.2. If absent, it is given by NB-IoT CellID mod 30. Value 30 is not used.
In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (ul-ReferenceSignalsNPUSCH): Used to specify parameters needed for the transmission on NPUSCH.
UL-ReferenceSignalsNPUSCH-NB-r13: In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (groupHoppingEnabled): See TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.1.4.1.3.
In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (groupAssignmentNPUSCH): See TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.1.4.1.3.
NPUSCH-ConfigDedicated-NB-r13: ENUMERATED {r1, r2, r4, r8, r16, r32, r64, r128}

In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (ack-NACK-NumRepetitions): Number of repetitions for the ACK NACK resource unit carrying HARQ response to NPDSCH, see TS 36.213 [23], clause 16.4.2. If this field is absent and no value was configured via dedicated signalling, the value used for reception of Msg4 is used.

Cond SRS: In NPUSCH-Config-NB: This field is optionally present, need OP, if srs-SubframeConfig is broadcasted.
Otherwise, the IE is not present.
In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (npusch-AllSymbols): If set to TRUE, the UE shall use all NB-IoT symbols for NPUSCH transmission. If set to FALSE, the UE punctures the NPUSCH transmissions in the symbols that collides with SRS. If the field is not present, the UE uses all NB-IoT symbols for NPUSCH transmission. See TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.1.3.6.
In NPUSCH-Config-NB field description (groupHoppingDisabled): See TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.1.4.1.3.
ACK-NACK-NumRepetitions-NB-r13: ENUMERATED {r1, r2, r4, r8, r16, r32, r64, r128}
NR-ResourceReservationConfig-NB-r16: In NR-ResourceReservationConfig-NB section description: The IE NR-ResourceReservationConfig-NB is used to specify the reserved downlink or uplink resources on a NB-IoT carrier deployed within a NR carrier.
ENUMERATED {ms10, ms20, ms40, ms80, ms160, spare3, spare2, spare1}

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig field description (periodicity): Periodicity of the reserved resource. Value ms10 corresponds to 10 milliseconds, value ms20 corresponds to 20 milliseconds, and so on.
periodicity in chapter5

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig field description (startPosition): Start time of the resource reservation pattern in one period. Unit in multiple of 10 milliseconds.
E-UTRAN configures the value of startPosition such as startPosition * 10 < periodicity.

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig field description (subframePattern10ms): For FDD: Downlink subframe-level resource reservation configuration over 10ms or 40ms.
Parameters valid-subframe-config-DL in TS 36.211 [21] and TS 36.213 [23].
The first/leftmost bit corresponds to the subframe #0 of the radio frame satisfying SFN mod x = startPosition, where x is the periodicity of the reserved resource divided by 10. Value 0 indicates that the corresponding subframe is not reserved, value 1 indicates that the corresponding subframe is reserved.

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig field description (subframePattern40ms): For FDD: Downlink subframe-level resource reservation configuration over 10ms or 40ms.
Parameters valid-subframe-config-DL in TS 36.211 [21] and TS 36.213 [23].
The first/leftmost bit corresponds to the subframe #0 of the radio frame satisfying SFN mod x = startPosition, where x is the periodicity of the reserved resource divided by 10. Value 0 indicates that the corresponding subframe is not reserved, value 1 indicates that the corresponding subframe is reserved.

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig field description (slotPattern10ms): For FDD: Downlink slot-level resource reservation configuration over 10ms or 40ms.
Parameter slot-reserved-resource-config-DL in TS 36.211 [21] and TS 36.213 [23]
The first/leftmost 2-bits corresponds to the subframe #0 of the radio frame satisfying SFN mod x = startPosition, where x is the periodicity of the reserved resource divided by 10. Two bits for each subframe coded as:
00: both slots are not reserved
01: the first slot is not reserved, the second slot is reserved
10: the first slot is reserved, the second slot is not reserved
11: both slots are reserved

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig field description (slotPattern40ms): For FDD: Downlink slot-level resource reservation configuration over 10ms or 40ms.
Parameter slot-reserved-resource-config-DL in TS 36.211 [21] and TS 36.213 [23]
The first/leftmost 2-bits corresponds to the subframe #0 of the radio frame satisfying SFN mod x = startPosition, where x is the periodicity of the reserved resource divided by 10. Two bits for each subframe coded as:
00: both slots are not reserved
01: the first slot is not reserved, the second slot is reserved
10: the first slot is reserved, the second slot is not reserved
11: both slots are reserved

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig field description (symbolBitmap): Provides the symbol-level resource reservation for one subframe.
E-UTRAN configures symbolConfigFddDl for a DL FDD NB-IoT carrier. E-UTRAN configures symbolConfigFddULOrTdd for an UL FDD NB-IoT carrier or a TDD NB-IoT carrier.

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig field description (symbolBitmapFddDl): For FDD: Downlink symbol-level resource reservation over the first or the second slot of one subframe, see TS 36.211 [21].
The first/leftmost bit corresponds to the symbol #0 in the slot. Value 0 indicates that the corresponding symbol is not reserved, value 1 indicates that the corresponding symbol is reserved. Symbols that carry NRS are not reserved.

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig field description (symbolBitmapFddUlOrTdd): For FDD: Uplink symbol-level resource reservation over the first or the second slot of one subframe, see TS 36.211 [21].
For TDD: Uplink or downlink symbol-level resource reservation over the first or the second slot of one subframe, see TS 36.211 [21].
The first/leftmost bit corresponds to the symbol #0 in the slot. Value 0 indicates that the corresponding symbol is not reserved, value 1 indicates that the corresponding symbol is reserved. Symbols that carry NRS are not reserved.
PDCP-Config-NB-r13: In PDCP-Config-NB section description: The IE PDCP-Config-NB is used to set the configurable PDCP parameters for data radio bearers.
ENUMERATED {ms5120, ms10240, ms20480, ms40960, ms81920, infinity, spare2, spare1}

Cond Setup: In PDCP-Config-NB: The field is mandatory present in case of radio bearer setup. Otherwise the field is optionally present, need ON.
In PDCP-Config-NB field description (discardTimer): Indicates the discard timer value specified in TS 36.323 [8]. Value in milliseconds. Value ms5120 means 5120 ms, ms10240 means 10240 ms and so on.
In PDCP-Config-NB field description (headerCompression): E-UTRAN does not reconfigure header compression except optionally upon RRC Connection Resumption.

DEFAULT 15
In PDCP-Config-NB field description (maxCID): Indicates the value of the MAX_CID parameter as specified in TS 36.323 [8]. The total value of MAX_CIDs across all bearers for the UE should be less than or equal to the value of maxNumberROHC-ContextSessions parameter as indicated by the UE.

In PDCP-Config-NB field description (profiles): The profiles used by both compressor and decompressor in both UE and E-UTRAN. The field indicates which of the ROHC profiles specified in TS 36.323 [8] are supported, i.e. value true indicates that the profile is supported. Profile 0x0000 shall always be supported when the use of ROHC is configured. If support of two ROHC profile identifiers with the same 8 LSB's is signalled, only the profile corresponding to the highest value shall be applied.
PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB-r13: In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB section description: The IE PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB is used to specify the UE specific physical channel configuration.

In CarrierConfigDedicated-NB section description: The IE CarrierConfigDedicated-NB is used to specify a carrier in NB-IoT.

In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB field description (carrierConfigDedicated): Anchor/ non-anchor carrier used for all unicast transmissions.
carrierConfigDedicated in chapter5

In NPDCCH-ConfigDedicated-NB section description: The IE NPDCCH-ConfigDedicated-NB specifies the subframes and resource blocks for NPDCCH monitoring.

In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB field description (npdcch-ConfigDedicated): NPDCCH configuration.
In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB field description (npusch-ConfigDedicated): UL unicast configuration.
In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB field description (twoHARQ-ProcessesConfig): Activation of two HARQ processes, see TS 36.212 [22] and TS 36.213 [23].

In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB field description (interferenceRandomisationConfig): For FDD: Interference randomisation enabled in connected mode, except for random access procedure in connected mode, see TS 36.211 [21]. For random access in connected mode interference randomisation on non-anchor is used and is not used on anchor carrier, see TS 36.211 [21].
For TDD: the parameter is not present.

Cond TDD: In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB: The field is optionally present, Need OR, for TDD; otherwise the field is not present and the UE shall delete any existing value for this field.
In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB field description (npdcch-ConfigDedicated): NPDCCH configuration.

Cond additionalSIB1: In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB: This field is optionally present, Need OR, if additionalTransmissionSIB1 is set to TRUE in MasterInformationBlock-NB; otherwise it is not present.
In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB field description (additionalTxSIB1-Config): Indicates if subframe #3 not containing additional SIB1 transmission is a NB-IoT DL subframe, as specified in TS 36.213 [23], clause 16.4.
In MultiTB-Config-NB section description: The IE MultiTB-Config-NB is used to specify the multiple TBs scheduling configuration for unicast transmission.

Cond DL-NR-COEX-NonAnchor: In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB: The field is optionally present, Need ON, for a DL non-anchor carrier deployed within a NR carrier; otherwise the field is not present and the UE shall delete any existing value for this field.
In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB field description (dl-NR-ResourceReservationConfig): Configuration of downlink reserved resources for NB-IoT co-existence with NR, see TS 36.211 [21], TS 36.212 [22], and TS 36.213 [22].

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig-NB section description: The IE NR-ResourceReservationConfig-NB is used to specify the reserved downlink or uplink resources on a NB-IoT carrier deployed within a NR carrier.
setup in chapter5

Cond UL-NR-COEX-NonAnchor: In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB: The field is optionally present, Need ON, for an UL non-anchor carrier deployed within a NR carrier; otherwise the field is not present and the UE shall delete any existing value for this field.
In PhysicalConfigDedicated-NB field description (ul-NR-ResourceReservationConfig): Configuration of uplink reserved resources for NB-IoT co-existence with NR, see TS 36.211 [21], TS 36.212 [22], and TS 36.213 [22].

In NR-ResourceReservationConfig-NB section description: The IE NR-ResourceReservationConfig-NB is used to specify the reserved downlink or uplink resources on a NB-IoT carrier deployed within a NR carrier.

PUR-Config-NB information element

In PUR-Config-NB field description (pur-TimeAlignmentTimer): Indicates the value of the time alignment timer for PUR. Value in number of pur-Periodicity.
pur-TimeAlignmentTimer in chapter5

In PUR-Config-NB field description (pur-NRSRP-ChangeThreshold): Indicates the threshold(s) of change in serving cell RSRP in dB for TA validation. Value dB4 corresponds to 4 dB, value dB6 corresponds to 6 dB, and so on. When nrsrp-ChangeThrsh is included, if nrsrp-DecreaseThrsh is absent the value of nrsrp-IncreaseThresh is also used for nrsrp-DecreaseThresh.

In PUR-Config-NB field description (pur-ImplicitReleaseAfter): Number of consecutive PUR occasions that can be skipped before implicit release of PUR configuration. Value n2 corresponds to 2 PUR occasions, value n4 corresponds to 4 PUR occasions, and so on.

In C-RNTI section description: The IE C-RNTI identifies a UE having a RRC connection within a cell.

In PUR-Config-NB field description (pur-RNTI): PUR-RNTI.
pur-RNTI in chapter5
ENUMERATED {pp1, pp2, pp3, pp4, pp8, pp16, pp32, pp64}

In PUR-Config-NB field description (pur-ResponseWindowTimer): Duration of the PUR response window in TS 36.321 [6]. Value in PDCCH periods. Value pp2 corresponds to 2 PDDCH periods, pp3 corresponds to 3 PDCCH periods, and so on.
The value considered by the UE is: pur-ResponseWindowSize = Min (signaled value x PDCCH period, 10.24s).

In PUR-Config-NB field description (pur-StartTime): Indicates the value of the time offset for the first PUR occasion, i.e. the time gap from reception of D-PUR configuration to the first PUR occasion. Value FFS.

In PUR-Config-NB field description (pur-Periodicity): Periodicity of PUR resource in number of hyper system frames in TS 36.321 [6].
Value hsf8 corresponds to 8 hyper system frames, value hsf16 corresponds to 16 hyper system frames, and so on.
In PUR-Config-NB field description (pur-NumOccasions): Number of PUR occasions. Value one corresponds to 1 PUR occasion, and value infinite corresponds to an infinite number of PUR occasions.

In DL-CarrierConfigCommon-NB section description: The IE DL-CarrierConfigCommon-NB is used to specify the common configuration of a DL non-anchor carrier in NB-IoT.

In PUR-Config-NB field description (dl-CarrierConfig): Downlink carrier used for PUR.

In CarrierFreq-NB section description: The IE CarrierFreq-NB is used to provide the NB-IoT carrier frequency, as defined in TS 36.101 [42].

ul-CarrierFreq in chapter5

In PUR-Config-NB field description (npusch-NumRUsIndex): This field contains an index to a table specified in TS 36.213 [23], Table 16.5.1.1-2, that defines number of resource units for NPUSCH for PUR.

In PUR-Config-NB field description (npusch-NumRepetitionsIndex): This field contains an index to a table specified in TS 36.213 [23], Table 16.5.1.1-3, that defines number of repetitions for NPUSCH for PUR.

In PUR-Config-NB field description (npusch-SubCarrierSetIndex): For NPUSCH transmission with subcarrier spacing 3.75 kHz, this field indicates the subcarrier used for PUR specified in TS 36.213 [23].
For NPUSCH transmission with subcarrier spacing 15 kHz, this field contains an index to a table specified in TS 36.213 [23], Table 16.5.1.1-1, that defines the set of subcarriers for NPUSCH for PUR.

In PUR-Config-NB field description (npusch-MCS): This field contains an index to tables specified in TS 36.213 [23], Table 16.5.1.2-1 and Table 16.5.1.2-2 for subcarrier spacing 3.75 kHz and 15 kHz respectively, that defines modulation and TBS index for NPUSCH for PUR.

RACH-ConfigCommon-NB-r13: In RACH-ConfigCommon-NB section description: The IE RACH-ConfigCommon-NB is used to specify the generic random access parameters.
ENUMERATED {n3, n4, n5, n6, n7, n8, n10, n20, n50, n100, n200}
In RACH-ConfigCommon-NB field description (preambleTransMax-CE): Maximum number of preamble transmission in TS 36.321 [6]. Value is an integer.

In RACH-ConfigCommon-NB field description (powerRampingParameters): Power ramping step and preamble initial received target power – same as TS 36.213 [23] and TS 36.321 [6].
For FDD, if the UE does not support enhanced random access power control and more than one repetition level is configured in the cell, then the UE transmits NPRACH with max power except for the lowest repetition level. Otherwise, the UE uses NPRACH power ramping.
For FDD, if the UE supports enhanced random access power control and powerRampingParameters-v1450 is signalled, or for TDD, the UE uses NPRACH power ramping across repetition levels as specified in TS 36.321 [6]. If preambleInitialReceivedTargetPower-v1450 is present, the UE shall use preambleInitialReceivedTargetPower-v1450 instead of preambleInitialReceivedTargetPower (i.e. without suffix). If powerRampingParametersCE1 is present, the UE shall use powerRampingParametersCE1 instead of powerRampingParameters for NPRACH power ramping in the second repetition level.

In RACH-ConfigCommon-NB field description (connEstFailOffset): Parameter "Qoffsettemp" in TS 36.304 [4]. If the field is not present the value of infinity shall be used for "Qoffsettemp".
connEstFailOffset in chapter5

In RACH-ConfigCommon-NB field description (powerRampingParameters): Power ramping step and preamble initial received target power – same as TS 36.213 [23] and TS 36.321 [6].
For FDD, if the UE does not support enhanced random access power control and more than one repetition level is configured in the cell, then the UE transmits NPRACH with max power except for the lowest repetition level. Otherwise, the UE uses NPRACH power ramping.
For FDD, if the UE supports enhanced random access power control and powerRampingParameters-v1450 is signalled, or for TDD, the UE uses NPRACH power ramping across repetition levels as specified in TS 36.321 [6]. If preambleInitialReceivedTargetPower-v1450 is present, the UE shall use preambleInitialReceivedTargetPower-v1450 instead of preambleInitialReceivedTargetPower (i.e. without suffix). If powerRampingParametersCE1 is present, the UE shall use powerRampingParametersCE1 instead of powerRampingParameters for NPRACH power ramping in the second repetition level.

For FDD: The value considered by the UE is: ra-ResponseWindowSize = Min (signaled value x PDCCH period, 10.24s).
For TDD: The value considered by the UE is: ra-ResponseWindowSize = Min (signaled value x PDCCH period, 20.48s).

For FDD: The value considered by the UE is: mac-ContentionResolutionTimer = Min (signaled value x PDCCH period, 10.24s).
For TDD: The value considered by the UE is: mac-ContentionResolutionTimer = Min (signaled value x PDCCH period, 20.48s).

RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB-r13: In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB section description: The IE RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB is used to specify common radio resource configurations in the system information, e.g., the random access parameters and the static physical layer parameters.
In RACH-ConfigCommon-NB section description: The IE RACH-ConfigCommon-NB is used to specify the generic random access parameters.
In NPRACH-ConfigSIB-NB section description: The IE NPRACH-ConfigSIB-NB is used to specify the NPRACH configuration for the anchor and non-anchor carriers.
In NPDSCH-ConfigCommon-NB section description: The IE NPDSCH-ConfigCommon-NB is used to specify the common NPDSCH configuration.

In NPUSCH-Config-NB section description: The IE NPUSCH-ConfigCommon-NB is used to specify the common NPUSCH configuration. The IE NPUSCH-ConfigDedicated-NB is used to specify the UE specific NPUSCH configuration.

In DL-GapConfig-NB section description: The IE DL-GapConfig-NB is used to specify the downlink gap configuration for NPDCCH and NPDSCH. Downlink gaps apply to all NPDCCH/NPDSCH transmissions except for BCCH.

In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB field description (dl-Gap): Downlink transmission gap configuration for the anchor carrier. See TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.2.3.4. If the field is absent, there is no gap.

In UplinkPowerControl-NB section description: The IE UplinkPowerControlCommon-NB and IE UplinkPowerControlDedicated-NB are used to specify parameters for uplink power control in the system information and in the dedicated signalling, respectively.
Cond EnhPowerControl: In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB: This field is optional present, Need OR, if PowerRampingParameters-NB-v1450 is included in SIB2-NB. Otherwise the field is not present.

Cond TDD: In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB: The field is optionally present, Need OR, for TDD; otherwise the field is not present and the UE shall delete any existing value for this field.
In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB field description (dl-Gap): Downlink transmission gap configuration for the anchor carrier. See TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.2.3.4. If the field is absent, there is no gap.

In WUS-Config-NB section description: The IE WUS-Config-NB is used to specify the WUS configuration. For UEs supporting WUS, E-UTRAN uses WUS to indicate that the UE shall attempt to receive paging in that cell, see TS 36.304 [4].

In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB field description (wus-Config): For FDD: WUS Configuration.
Cond TDD1: In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB: The field is mandatory present for TDD; otherwise the field is not present and the UE shall delete any existing value for this field.

In GWUS-Config-NB section description: The IE GWUS-Config-NB is used to specify the GWUS configuration. For UEs supporting GWUS, E-UTRAN uses GWUS to indicate that the UE shall attempt to receive paging in that cell, see TS 36.304 [4].

In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB field description (gwus-Config): For FDD: GWUS Configuration.

In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB field description (nrs-NonAnchorConfig): For FDD: This field indicates if NRS are present on non-anchor paging carriers even when no paging NPDCCH is transmitted, see TS 36.211 [21], clause 10.2.6.
BCCH-Config-NB-r13:
In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB field description (modificationPeriodCoeff): Actual modification period, expressed in number of radio frames= modificationPeriodCoeff * defaultPagingCycle. n16 corresponds to value 16, n32 corresponds to value 32, and so on. The BCCH modification period should be larger or equal to 40.96s.
modificationPeriodCoeff in chapter5

In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB field description (defaultPagingCycle): Default paging cycle, used to derive 'T' in TS 36.304 [4]. Value rf128 corresponds to 128 radio frames, rf256 corresponds to 256 radio frames and so on.
defaultPagingCycle in chapter5

PCCH-Config-NB-v16xy: In RadioResourceConfigCommonSIB-NB field description (ue-SpecificDRX-Allowed-EPC): This field indicates if the NB-IoT UE is allowed to use UE specific DRX for paging when connected to EPC.
RadioResourceConfigDedicated-NB-r13: In RadioResourceConfigDedicated-NB section description: The IE RadioResourceConfigDedicated-NB is used to setup/modify/release RBs, to modify the MAC main configuration, and to modify dedicated physical configuration.

In RadioResourceConfigDedicated-NB field description (mac-MainConfig): The default MAC MAIN configuration is specified in 9.2.2.
mac-MainConfig in chapter5

In MAC-MainConfig-NB section description: The IE MAC-MainConfig-NB is used to specify the MAC main configuration for signalling and data radio bearers.

In SchedulingRequestConfig-NB field description (nprach-ResourceIndex): Index of the NPRACH resource in the list of NPRACH resources in NPRACH-ParametersList or NPRACH-ParametersList-Fmt2 for the UL carrier indicated by nprach-CarrierIndex. The first entry in the list has index '1', the second entry has index '2' and so on.
E-UTRAN configures a NPRACH resource in NPRACH-ParametersList-Fmt2 only to UEs that have reported support of NPRACH resource Format2.

In SchedulingRequestConfig-NB field description (nprach-SubCarrierIndex): Index of the subcarrier in the NPRACH resource in NPRACH-ParametersList or or NPRACH-ParametersList-Fmt2 for the indicated UL carrier.
E-UTRAN does not configure nprach-SubcarrierIndex to a smaller value than nprach-SubcarrierOffset + nprach-NumCBRA-StartSubcarriers for the indicated NPRACH resource.

In WUS-Config-NB field description (maxDurationFactor): Maximum WUS duration, expressed as a ratio of Rmax for Type 1-CSS. Value one128th means Rmax * 1/128, value one64th means Rmax * 1/64 and so on.
The value
𝐿
NWUS_max
in TS 36.213 [23] considered by the UE is : maxDuration = Max (signalled value * Rmax, 1) where Rmax is the value of npdcch-NumRepetitionPaging for the carrier.

In WUS-Config-NB field description (numPOs): Number of consecutive Paging Occasions (PO) mapped to one Wake Up Signal (WUS), applicable to UEs configured to use extended DRX, see TS 36.304 [4]. Value n1 corresponds to 1 PO and value n2 corresponds to 2 POs and so on.

In WUS-Config-NB field description (numDRX-CyclesRelaxed): Maximum number of consecutive DRX cycles during which the UE may use WUS for synchronisation and skip serving cell measurements, see TS 36.133 [16]. Value n1 corresponds to 1 DRX cycle, value n2 corresponds to 2 DRX cycles and so on.

In WUS-Config-NB field description (timeOffsetDRX): When DRX is used, non-zero gap from the end of the configured maximum WUS duration to the associated PO, see TS 36.304 [4], clause 7.4 and TS 36.211 [21]. In milliseconds. Value ms40 corresponds to 40ms, value ms80 corresponds to 80 ms and so on.

In WUS-Config-NB field description (timeOffset-eDRX-Short): When eDRX is used, the short non-zero gap from the end of the configured maximum WUS duration to the associated PO, see TS 36.304 [4], clause 7.4 and TS 36.211 [21]. In milliseconds. Value ms40 corresponds to 40ms, value ms80 corresponds to 80 ms and so on.
E-UTRAN configures timeOffset-eDRX-Short to a value longer than or equal to timeOffsetDRX.

In WUS-Config-NB field description (timeOffset-eDRX-Long): When eDRX is used, the long non-zero gap from the end of the configured maximum WUS duration to the associated PO, see TS 36.304 [4], clause 7.4 and TS 36.211 [21]. In milliseconds. Value ms1000 corresponds to 1000 ms, value ms2000 corresponds to 2000 ms.

In NSSS-RRM-Config-NB field description (nsss-RRM-PowerOffset): NSSS to NRS ratio for the serving cell as specified in TS 36.214 [48]. Value in dB. Value dB-3 corresponds to -3 dB, dB0 corresponds to 0 dB and so on.

In NSSS-RRM-Config-NB field description (nsss-NumOccDiffPrecoders): Number of consecutive NSSS occasions that use different precoders for NSSS transmission.See TS 36.211 [21]. Value n1 corresponds to 1 occasion, n2 corresponds to 2 occasions and so on.
For value n2, n4, and n8, UE may assume for nsss-NumOccDiffPrecoders consecutive NSSS occasions, E-UTRAN uses different precoders for NSSS transmission. For value n1, UE may assume that E-UTRAN always uses the same precoder.
If the field is absent, the UE makes no assumption on the antenna port(s) used for NSSS.

This field defines the release of the E-UTRA layer 1, 2, and 3 specifications supported by the UE e.g. Rel-8, Rel-9, etc.

In 36306-g00 4.3.8.5 multipleDRB-r13
This field defines whether the UE supports multiple DRBs. This field is only applicable if the UE supports S1-U data transfer or User plane CIoT EPS Optimisation, as defined in TS 24.301 [28] and any ue-Category-NB. If a UE of this release supports multiple DRBs, the UE shall support two simultaneous DRBs.

In 36306-g00 4.3.8.7 earlyData-UP-r15
This field defines whether the UE supports MO-EDT for User Plane CIoT EPS optimizations, as defined in TS 24.301 [28]. This feature is only applicable if the UE supports ce-ModeA-r13, or for FDD if the UE supports any ue-Category-NB.

In 36306-g00 4.3.8.11 earlySecurityReactivation-r16

earlySecurityReactivation in chapter5

In 36306-g00 4.3.36.9 earlyData-UP-5GC-r16
This field indicates whether the UE supports MO-EDT for User Plane CIoT 5GS optimisations, as defined in TS 24.501 [39]. This feature is only applicable if the UE supports ce-ModeA-r13, or for FDD if the UE supports any ue-Category-NB.

In 36306-g00 4.3.8.12 pur-CP-EPC-r16
This field indicates whether the UE supports Transmission using PUR for Control Plane CIoT EPS optimisation, as defined in TS 36.300 [30]. This feature is only applicable if the UE supports ce-ModeA-r13, or for FDD if the UE supports any ue-Category-NB.

In 36306-g00 4.3.8.13 pur-UP-EPC-r16
This field indicates whether the UE supports Transmission using PUR for User Plane CIoT EPS optimisation, as defined in TS 36.300 [30]. This feature is only applicable if the UE supports ce-ModeA-r13, or for FDD if the UE supports any ue-Category-NB.

PDCP-Parameters-NB-r13:
In 36306-g00 4.3.1.1A supportedROHC-Profiles-r13
This field defines which ROHC profiles from the list below are supported by the UE:
- 0x0000 ROHC uncompressed (RFC 5795)
- 0x0002 ROHC UDP (RFC 3095, RFC 4815)
- 0x0003 ROHC ESP (RFC 3095, RFC 4815)
- 0x0004 ROHC IP (RFC 3843, RFC 4815)
- 0x0006 ROHC TCP (RFC 6846)
- 0x0102 ROHCv2 UDP (RFC 5225)
- 0x0103 ROHCv2 ESP (RFC 5225)
- 0x0104 ROHCv2 IP (RFC 5225)
A UE that supports one or more of the listed ROHC profiles shall support ROHC profile 0x0000 ROHC uncompressed (RFC 5795). This field is only applicable if the UE supports S1-U data transfer or User plane CIoT EPS Optimisation, see TS 36.331 [5], and any ue-Category-NB.

In 36306-g00 4.3.1.1 supportedROHC-Profiles
This field defines which ROHC profiles from the list below are supported by the UE.
- 0x0000 ROHC uncompressed (RFC 5795)
- 0x0001 ROHC RTP (RFC 3095, RFC 4815)
- 0x0002 ROHC UDP (RFC 3095, RFC 4815)
- 0x0003 ROHC ESP (RFC 3095, RFC 4815)
- 0x0004 ROHC IP (RFC 3843, RFC 4815)
- 0x0006 ROHC TCP (RFC 6846)
- 0x0101 ROHCv2 RTP (RFC 5225)
- 0x0102 ROHCv2 UDP (RFC 5225)
- 0x0103 ROHCv2 ESP (RFC 5225)
- 0x0104 ROHCv2 IP (RFC 5225)
A UE that supports one or more of the listed ROHC profiles shall support ROHC profile 0x0000 ROHC uncompressed (RFC 5795).
'IMS capable UEs supporting voice' shall support ROHC profiles 0x0000, 0x0001, 0x0002 and be able to compress and decompress headers of PDCP SDUs at a PDCP SDU rate corresponding to supported IMS voice codecs.

DEFAULT cs2
In 36306-g00 4.3.1.2A maxNumberROHC-ContextSessions-r13
This field defines the maximum number of header compression context sessions supported by the UE, excluding context sessions that leave all headers uncompressed. This field is only applicable if the UE supports S1-U data transfer or User plane CIoT EPS Optimisation, see TS 36.331 [5], and any ue-Category-NB.

In 36306-g00 4.3.1.2 maxNumberROHC-ContextSessions
This field defines the maximum number of header compression context sessions supported by the UE, excluding context sessions that leave all headers uncompressed.

In 36306-g00 4.3.19.10 rai-Support-r14

In 36306-g00 4.3.6.37 dl-ChannelQualityReporting-r16
This field defines whether the UE supports DL channel quality reporting of the serving cell or configured carrier for FDD in RRC_CONNECTED as specified in TS 36.331 [5]. This feature is only applicable if the UE supports ce-ModeA-r13 or if the UE supports any ue-Category-NB.

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.55 multiTone-r13
This field defines whether the UE supports UL multi-tone transmissions on NPUSCH. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB. It is mandatory for UEs of this release of the specification.

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.56 multiCarrier-r13
This field defines whether the UE supports multi-carrier operation. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB. It is mandatory for UEs of this release of the specification.
multiCarrier in chapter5

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.75 multiCarrier-NPRACH-r14

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.62 twoHARQ-Processes-r14
This field defines whether the UE supports 2 HARQ processes in DL and UL. This field is only applicable for UEs that support category NB2.
PhyLayerParameters-NB-v1440:
In 36306-g00 4.3.4.80 interferenceRandomisation-r14
This field indicates whether the UE supports interference randomisation in connected mode for FDD as specified in TS 36.211 [17]. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB. It is mandatory for UEs of this release of the specification.

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.115 mixedOperationMode-r15
This field defines whether the UE supports multi-carrier operation where the anchor carrier is in standalone mode while the non-anchor carrier is in inband or guardand mode, and vice versa, for unicast, paging, and random access for FDD as specified in TS 36.300 [30]. In 36306-g00 4.3.4.117 sr-WithHARQ-ACK-r15
This field defines whether the UE supports physical layer SR with HARQ ACK for FDD as specified in TS 36.213 [22]. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB.

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.118 sr-WithoutHARQ-ACK-r15
This field defines whether the UE supports physical layer SR without HARQ ACK for FDD as specified in TS 36.211 [17] and TS 36.213 [22]. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB.
sr-WithoutHARQ-ACK in chapter5

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.119 nprach-Format2-r15
This field defines whether the UE supports NPRACH resources using preamble format 2 for FDD. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB.

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.137 additionalTransmissionSIB1-r15
This field defines whether the UE supports additional SIB1 transmission in subframe #3 for FDD, as defined in TS 36.213 [22]. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB.

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.182 multiTB-UL-r16

UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB-r13: In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB section description: The IE UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB contains UE NB-IoT capability information needed for paging.

In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB field description (ue-Category-NB): UE NB-IoT category as defined in TS 36.306 [5]. Value nb1 corresponds to UE category NB1, value nb2 corresponds to UE category NB2.
A UE shall always include the field ue-Category-NB-r13 in this version of the specification.

In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB field description (multiCarrierPaging): Indicates whether the UE supports paging on non-anchor carriers as defined in TS 36.304 [4].

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.76 multiCarrierPaging-r14
This field defines whether the UE supports paging on non-anchor carriers for FDD, as specified in TS 36.331 [5] and TS 36.304 [14]. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB. It is mandatory for UEs of this release of the specification.

In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB field description (mixedOperationMode): Indicates whether the UE supports multi-carrier operation with mixed operation mode, standalone or inband/guardband, between the anchor carrier and non-anchor carrier for unicast, paging, and random access, as specified in TS 36.300 [9].

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.115 mixedOperationMode-r15
This field defines whether the UE supports multi-carrier operation where the anchor carrier is in standalone mode while the non-anchor carrier is in inband or guardand mode, and vice versa, for unicast, paging, and random access for FDD as specified in TS 36.300 [30]. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB.

In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB field description (wakeUpSignal): Indicates whether the UE supports WUS for paging in DRX in FDD as specified in TS 36.304 [4]. If this field is included, the minimum gap between WUS and associated PO for DRX is fixed as 40 ms.

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.113 wakeUpSignal-r15
This field indicates whether the UE supports WUS for FDD as specified in TS 36.211 [17], TS 36.213 [22] and TS 36.304 [14]. This feature is only applicable if the UE supports ce-ModeA-r13 or if the UE supports any ue-Category-NB.

In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB field description (wakeUpSignalMinGap-eDRX): Indicates the minimum gap the UE supports between WUS or GWUS and associated PO in case of eDRX in FDD, as specified in TS 36.304 [4]. Value ms40 corresponds to 40 ms, value ms240 corresponds to 240 ms and so on.
If this field is included, the UE shall also indicate support for WUS or GWUS for paging in DRX.

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.114 wakeUpSignalMinGap-eDRX-r15
This field indicates the minimum gap required between end of WUS and start of PO by a UE indicating support of extended idle mode DRX for FDD, as specified in TS 24.301 [28]. A UE indicating support of wakeUpSignalMinGap-eDRX-r15 shall also indicate support of wakeUpSignal-r15. This feature is only applicable if the UE supports ce-ModeA-r13 or if the UE supports any ue-Category-NB.

In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB field description (multiCarrierPagingTDD): Indicates whether the UE supports paging on non-anchor carriers for TDD as defined in TS 36.304 [4].

In 36306-g00 4.3.4.134 multiCarrierPagingTDD-r15
This field defines whether the UE supports paging on non-anchor carriers for TDD, as specified in TS 36.331 [5] and TS 36.304 [14]. This field is only applicable for UEs of any ue-Category-NB. It is mandatory for UEs of this release of the specification.

In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB field description (ue-Category-NB): UE NB-IoT category as defined in TS 36.306 [5]. Value nb1 corresponds to UE category NB1, value nb2 corresponds to UE category NB2.
A UE shall always include the field ue-Category-NB-r13 in this version of the specification.

In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB field description (groupWakeUpSignal): Indicates whether the UE supports GWUS as specified in TS 36.211 [21], TS 36.213 [23] and TS 36.304 [4]. If this field is included, the minimum gap between GWUS and associated PO for DRX is fixed as 40 ms.
UE-TimersAndConstants-NB-r13: In UE-TimersAndConstants-NB section description: The IE UE-TimersAndConstants-NB contains timers and constants used by the UE in either RRC_CONNECTED or RRC_IDLE.
ENUMERATED {ms0, ms200, ms500, ms1000, ms2000, ms4000, ms8000}
ENUMERATED {n1, n2, n3, n4, n6, n8, n10, n20}
ENUMERATED {n1, n2, n3, n4, n5, n6, n8, n10}
Cond TDD: In UE-TimersAndConstants-NB: The field is optionally present, Need OR, in TDD mode. Otherwise, the field is not present.
Cond TDD: In UE-TimersAndConstants-NB: The field is optionally present, Need OR, in TDD mode. Otherwise, the field is not present.
Cond TDD: In UE-TimersAndConstants-NB: The field is optionally present, Need OR, in TDD mode. Otherwise, the field is not present.

Cond EDTorPUR: In UE-TimersAndConstants-NB: The field is optionally present, Need OR, if edt-Parameters or cp-PUR-5GC or cp-PUR-EPC or up-PUR-5GC or up-PUR-EPC is present in SIB2-NB; otherwise the field is not present and the UE shall delete any existing value for this field.
SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB-r14: In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB section description: The IE SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB provides the list of ongoing MBMS sessions transmitted via SC-MRB and for each MBMS session, the associated G-RNTI and scheduling information.
SC-MTCH-Info-NB-r14: In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (sc-mtch-CarrierConfig): Downlink carrier that is used for SC-MTCH.

In DL-CarrierConfigCommon-NB section description: The IE DL-CarrierConfigCommon-NB is used to specify the common configuration of a DL non-anchor carrier in NB-IoT.

In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (dl-CarrierConfig): Downlink carrier used for SC-MTCH. E-UTRAN cannot configure a downlink carrier operating in mixed operation mode.

In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (dl-CarrierIndex): Index to a downlink carrier signalled in system information. Value '0' corresponds to the anchor carrier, value '1' corresponds to the first entry in dl-ConfigList in SystemInformationBlockType22-NB, value '2' corresponds to the second entry in dl-ConfigList and so on.
In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (mbmsSessionInfo): Indicates the ongoing MBMS session in a SC-MTCH.

In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (g-RNTI): G-RNTI used to scramble the scheduling and transmission of a SC-MTCH.
g-RNTI in chapter5

In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (sc-mtch-SchedulingInfo): DRX information for the SC-MTCH.
If this field is absent, DRX is not used for the SC-MTCH.
sc-mtch-SchedulingInfo in chapter5

In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (sc-mtch-NeighbourCell): Indicates neighbour cells which also provide this service on SC-MTCH. The first bit is set to 1 if the service is provided on SC-MTCH in the first cell in scptmNeighbourCellList, otherwise it is set to 0. The second bit is set to 1 if the service is provided on SC-MTCH in the second cell in scptmNeighbourCellList, and so on. If this field is absent, the UE shall assume that this service is not available on SC-MTCH in any neighbour cell.

In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (npdcch-NPDSCH-MaxTBS-SC-MTCH): Maximum NPDSCH TBS for the SC-MTCH, see TS 36.213 [23]. Value n680 corresponds to 680 bits and value n2536 corresponds to 2536 bits.
ENUMERATED {r1, r2, r4, r8, r16, r32, r64, r128, r256, r512, r1024, r2048, spare4, spare3, spare2, spare1}
ENUMERATED {v1dot5, v2, v4, v8, v16, v32, v48, v64}
In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (npdcch-startSF-SC-MTCH): Starting subframes configuration of the NPDCCH multicast search space for SC-MTCH, see TS 36.213 [23].
ENUMERATED {zero, oneEighth, oneQuarter, threeEighth, oneHalf, fiveEighth, threeQuarter, sevenEighth}
In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (npdcch-Offset-SC-MTCH): Fractional period offset of starting subframe for NPDCCH multicast search space for SC-MTCH, see TS 36.213 [23].
SC-MTCH-SchedulingInfo-NB-r14: ENUMERATED {pp1, pp2, pp3, pp4, pp8, pp16, pp32, spare}

In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (onDurationTimerSCPTM): Timer for SC-MTCH reception in TS 36.321 [6]. Value in number of NPDCCH periods. Value pp1 corresponds to 1 NPDCCH period, pp2 corresponds to 2 NPDCCH periods and so on.
ENUMERATED {pp0, pp1, pp2, pp3, pp4, pp8, pp16, pp32}

In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (drx-InactivityTimerSCPTM): Timer for SC-MTCH reception in TS 36.321 [6]. Value in number of NPDCCH periods. Value pp1 corresponds to 1 NPDCCH period, pp2 corresponds to 2 NPDCCH periods and so on.

In SC-MTCH-InfoList-NB field description (schedulingPeriodStartOffsetSCPTM): SCPTM-SchedulingCycle and SCPTM-SchedulingOffset in TS 36.321 [6]. The value of SCPTM-SchedulingCycle is in number of sub-frames. Value sf10 corresponds to 10 sub-frames, sf20 corresponds to 20 sub-frames and so on. The value of SCPTM-SchedulingOffset is in number of sub-frames.
SCPTM-NeighbourCellList-NB-r14: In SCPTM-NeighbourCellList-NB section description: The IE SCPTM-NeighbourCellList-NB indicates a list of neighbour cells where ongoing MBMS sessions provided via SC-MRB in the current cells are also provided.

In PhysCellId section description: The IE PhysCellId is used to indicate the physical layer identity of the cell, as defined in TS 36.211 [21].

In SCPTM-NeighbourCellList-NB field description (physCellId): Physical Cell Identity of the neighbour cell.
physCellId in chapter5

In CarrierFreq-NB section description: The IE CarrierFreq-NB is used to provide the NB-IoT carrier frequency, as defined in TS 36.101 [42].

In SCPTM-NeighbourCellList-NB field description (carrierFreq): Carrier frequency of the neighbour cell.

In VarMeasConfig section description: The UE variable VarMeasConfig includes the accumulated configuration of the measurements to be performed by the UE, covering intra-frequency, inter-frequency and inter-RAT mobility related measurements.

If the number of frequencies configured for a particular RAT exceeds the minimum performance requirements specified in TS 36.133 [16], it is up to UE implementation which frequencies of that RAT are measured. If the total number of frequencies for all RATs provided to the UE in the measurement configuration exceeds the minimum performance requirements specified in TS 36.133 [16], it is up to UE implementation which frequencies/RATs are measured.

preconfigComm in chapter5

In SL-Preconfiguration field description (preconfigComm): Indicates a list of resource pools. The first resource pool in the list is used for both reception and transmission of sidelink communication. The other resource pools, if present, are only used for reception of sidelink communication.
preconfigComm in chapter5

In SL-Preconfiguration field description (commTxPoolList): Indicates a list of transmission pools for sidelink communication in addition to the first resource pool within preconfigComm.
SL-PreconfigGeneral-r12:
In SL-Preconfiguration field description (carrierFreq): Indicates the carrier frequency for out of coverage sidelink communication and sidelink discovery. In case of FDD it is uplink carrier frequency and the corresponding downlink frequency can be determined from the default TX-RX frequency separation defined in TS 36.101 [42], table 5.7.3-1.
carrierFreq in chapter5

In P-Max section description: The IE P-Max is used to limit the UE's uplink transmission power on a carrier frequency and is used to calculate the parameter Pcompensation defined in TS 36.304 [4]. Corresponds to parameter PEMAX or PEMAX,c in TS 36.101 [42]. The UE transmit power on one serving cell shall not exceed the configured maximum UE output power of the serving cell determined by this value as specified in TS 36.101 [42], clauses 6.2.5 or 6.2.5A, or, when transmitting sidelink discovery announcements within the coverage of the concerned cell, as specified in TS 36.101 [42], clause 6.2.5D.
maxTxPower in chapter5

In AdditionalSpectrumEmission section description: If an extension is signalled using the extended value range (as defined by IE AdditionalSpectrumEmission-v10l0), the corresponding original field, using the value range as defined by IE AdditionalSpectrumEmission i.e. without suffix) shall be set to value 32, if signalled. UE supporting an LTE band assigned NS values larger than 32 as defined in TS 36.101 [42], clause 6.2.4, needs to support extension signaling (as defined by IE AdditionalSpectrumEmission-v10l0).

In SL-Preconfiguration field description (additionalSpectrumEmission): The UE requirements related to IE AdditionalSpectrumEmission are defined in TS 36.101 [42], clause 6.2.4. If additionalSpectrumEmissionExt-r14 is configured, the UE only considers additionalSpectrumEmissionExt-r14 (and ignores additionalSpectrumEmission-r12).

SL-V2X-Preconfiguration in chapter5

In SL-AnchorCarrierFreqList-V2X section description: The IE SL-AnchorCarrierFreqList-V2X specifies the SL V2X anchor frequencies i.e. frequencies that include inter-carrier resource configuration for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (anchorCarrierFreqList): Indicates carrier frequencies which may include inter-carrier resource configuration for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (cbr-PreconfigList): Indicates the preconfigured list of CBR ranges and the list of PSSCH transmission configurations available to configure congestion control to the UE for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig section description: The IE SL-V2X-PacketDuplicationConfig specifies the configuration information for sidelink packet duplication for V2X sidelink communication transmission.

In SL-V2X-SyncFreqList section description: The IE SL-V2X-SyncFreqList specifies the list of candidate synchronisation carrier frequencies used for V2X sidelink communication.
syncFreqList in chapter5

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (v2x-TxProfileList): Indicates for each Tx profile the corresponding transmission format, used as specified in TS 36.321 [6], in order of increasing Tx profile pointer identities. For each entry, Value REL14 indicates that the UE shall use Release 14 compatible format (i.e. using MCS table in Table 8.6.1-1 with 64 QAM indices overridden by 16QAM in TS 36.213 [23] and not Rel-15 feature) to transmit the corresponding V2X packet. Value REL15 indicates that the UE shall use Release 15 format (i.e. using rate matching, TBS scaling, MCS table in Table 8.6.1 and, if applicable, the MCS indices supporting 64QAM in Table 8.6.1 and Table 14.1.1-2 in TS 36.213 [23]) to transmit the corresponding V2X packet. If v2x-TxProfileList is not configured by upper layers, the UE shall use Release 14 compatible format to transmit the corresponding V2X packet.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (v2x-CommRxPoolList): Indicates a list of reception pools for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (v2x-CommTxPoolList): Indicates a list of transmission pools for V2X sidelink communication.
v2x-CommTxPoolList in chapter5

In SL-CommTxPoolSensingConfig section description: The IE SL-CommTxPoolSensingConfig specifies V2X sidelink communication configurations used for UE autonomous resource selection.

In SL-ZoneConfig section description: The IE SL-ZoneConfig indicates zone configurations used for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (zoneConfig): Indicates zone configurations used for V2X sidelink communication in 5.10.13.2.
zoneConfig in chapter5

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (syncPriority): Indicates the synchronization priority order. In case the UE does not detect any cell which configures synchronization configuration on the carrier frequency in anchorCarrierFreqList, if this field is set to gnss, the UE shall prioritize GNSS over the UE directly synchronized to eNB; if this field is set to enb, the UE shall prioritize the UE directly synchronized to eNB over GNSS.
syncPriority in chapter5

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (thresSL-TxPrioritization): Indicates the threshold used to determine whether SL V2X transmission is prioritized over uplink transmission if they overlap in time (see TS 36.321 [6]).

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (offsetDFN): Indicates the timing offset for the UE to determine DFN timing when GNSS is used for timing reference. Value 0 corresponds to 0 milliseconds, value 1 corresponds to 0.001 milliseconds, value 2 corresponds to 0.002 milliseconds, and so on.
offsetDFN in chapter5

In SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfigList section description: The IE SL-V2X-FreqSelectionConfigList specifies the configuration information for carrier selection for V2X sidelink communication transmission using UE autonomous resource selection.
SL-V2X-PreconfigCommPool-r14:
In SL-OffsetIndicator section description: The IE SL-OffsetIndicator indicates the offset of the pool of resources relative to SFN 0 of the cell from which it was obtained or, when out of coverage, relative to DFN 0.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (sl-OffsetIndicator): Indicates the offset of the first subframe of a resource pool within a SFN cycle. If absent, the resource pool starts from first subframe of SFN=0. This field is not applicable to V2X sidelink communication.
In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (sl-Subframe): Indicates the bitmap of the resource pool, which is is defined by repeating the bitmap within a SFN cycle (see TS 36.213 [23]).

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (adjacencyPSCCH-PSSCH): Indicates whether a UE always transmits PSCCH and PSSCH in adjacent RBs (indicated by TRUE) or it may transmit PSCCH and PSSCH in non-adjacent RBs (indicated by FALSE). This parameter appears only when a pool is configured such that a UE transmits PSCCH and the associated PSSCH in the same subframe.
adjacencyPSCCH-PSSCH in chapter5

ENUMERATED {n4, n5, n6, n8, n9, n10, n12, n15, n16, n18, n20, n25, n30, n48, n50, n72, n75, n96, n100, spare13, spare12, spare11, spare10, spare9, spare8, spare7, spare6, spare5, spare4, spare3, spare2, spare1}

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (sizeSubchannel): Indicates the number of PRBs of each subchannel in the corresponding resource pool. The value n5 denotes 5 PRBs; n6 denotes 6 PRBs and so on. The values n5, n6, n10, n15, n20, n25, n50, n75 and n100 apply in the case of adjacencyPSCCH-PSSCH set to TRUE; the values n4, n5, n6, n8, n9, n10, n12, n15, n16, n18, n20, n30, n48, n72 and n96 apply in the case of adjacencyPSCCH-PSSCH set to FALSE.
