In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (numSubchannel): Indicates the number of subchannels in the corresponding resource pool.
In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (startRB-Subchannel): Indicates the lowest RB index of the subchannel with the lowest index.
In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (startRB-PSCCH-Pool): Indicates the lowest RB index of the PSCCH pool.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (zoneID): Indicates the zone ID for which the UE shall use this resource pool as described in 5.10.13.2. The field is absent in v2x-CommRxPoolList and p2x-CommTxPoolList in SL-V2X-PreconfigFreqInfo.
zoneID in chapter5

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (threshS-RSSI-CBR): Indicates the S-RSSI threshold for determining the contribution of a sub-channel to the CBR measurement, as specified in TS 36.214 [48]. Value 0 corresponds to -112 dBm, value 1 to -110 dBm, value n to (-112 + n*2) dBm, and so on.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (cbr-pssch-TxConfigList): Indicates the mapping between PPPPs, CBR ranges by using indexes of the entry in cbr-RangeCommonConfigList in cbr-PreconfigList, and PSSCH transmission parameters and CR limits by using indexes of the entry in sl-CBR-PSSCH-TxConfigList in cbr-PreconfigList.

In SL-P2X-ResourceSelectionConfig section description: The IE SL-P2X-ResourceSelectionConfig includes the configuration of resource selection for P2X related V2X sidelink communication. E-UTRAN configures at least one resource selection mechanism.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (resourceSelectionConfigP2X): Indicates the allowed resource selection mechanism(s), i.e. partial sensing and/or random selection, for P2X related V2X sidelink communication.
resourceSelectionConfigP2X in chapter5

In SL-SyncAllowed section description: The IE SL-SyncAllowed indicates the allowed the synchronization references for a transmission resource pool for V2X sidelink communication.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (syncAllowed): Indicates the allowed synchronization reference(s) which is (are) allowed to use the pre-configured resource pool.

In SL-RestrictResourceReservationPeriodList section description: The IE SL-RestrictResourceReservationPeriodList indicates which values are allowed for the signaling of the resource reservation period in PSCCH for V2X sidelink communication, see TS 36.321 [6].

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (restrictResourceReservationPeriod): If configured, the field restrictResourceReservationPeriod configured in v2x-ResourceSelectionConfig shall be ignored for transmission on this pool.

In SL-V2X-Preconfiguration field description (cbr-pssch-TxConfigList): Indicates the mapping between PPPPs, CBR ranges by using indexes of the entry in cbr-RangeCommonConfigList in cbr-PreconfigList, and PSSCH transmission parameters and CR limits by using indexes of the entry in sl-CBR-PSSCH-TxConfigList in cbr-PreconfigList.
SL-PreconfigV2X-Sync-r14: ENUMERATED {fc0, fc1, fc2, fc3, fc4, fc5, fc6, fc7, fc8, fc9, fc11, fc13, fc15, fc17, fc19, spare1, ...}

In FilterCoefficient section description: The IE FilterCoefficient specifies the measurement filtering coefficient. Value fc0 corresponds to k = 0, fc1 corresponds to k = 1, and so on.
filterCoefficient in chapter5
ENUMERATED {dB0, dB3, dB6, dB9, dB12, dBinf}
SL-V2X-TxProfileList-r15: ENUMERATED {rel14, rel15, spare6, spare5, spare4, spare3, spare2, spare1, ...}
SL-V2X-TxProfile-r15: ENUMERATED {rel14, rel15, spare6, spare5, spare4, spare3, spare2, spare1, ...}
HandoverCommand:
In HandoverCommand section description: This message is used to transfer the handover command generated by the target eNB.
Direction: target eNB to source eNB/ source RAN
HandoverCommand-r8-IEs: In HandoverCommand field description (handoverCommandMessage): Contains the entire DL-DCCH-Message including the RRCConnectionReconfiguration message used to perform handover within E-UTRAN or handover to E-UTRAN, generated (entirely) by the target eNB.

In DL-DCCH-Message section description: The DL-DCCH-Message class is the set of RRC messages that may be sent from the E-UTRAN to the UE or from the E-UTRAN to the RN on the downlink DCCH logical channel.
HandoverPreparationInformation:
In HandoverPreparationInformation section description: This message is used to transfer the E-UTRA RRC information used by the target eNB or target ng-eNB during handover preparation or UE context retrieval, e.g. in case of resume or re-establishment, including UE capability information.
Direction: source eNB/ source RAN to target eNB or target ng-eNB
HandoverPreparationInformation-r8-IEs:
In UE-CapabilityRAT-ContainerList section description: The IE UE-CapabilityRAT-ContainerList contains list of containers, one for each RAT for which UE capabilities are transferred, if any.

In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (ue-RadioAccessCapabilityInfo): For E-UTRA radio access capabilities, it is up to E-UTRA how the backward compatibility among supportedBandCombinationReduced, supportedBandCombination and supportedBandCombinationAdd is ensured. If supportedBandCombinationReduced and supportedBandCombination/supportedBandCombinationAdd are included into ueCapabilityRAT-Container, it can be assumed that the value of fields, requestedBands, reducedIntNonContCombRequested and requestedCCsXL are consistend with all supported band combination fields. NOTE 2
In HandoverPreparationInformation section: NOTE 2: The following table indicates per source RAT whether RAT capabilities are included or not.

Cond HO: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is mandatory present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In AS-Config section description: The AS-Config IE contains information about RRC configuration information in the source eNB which can be utilized by target eNB to determine the need to change the RRC configuration during the handover preparation phase. The information can also be used after the handover is successfully performed or during the RRC connection re-establishment or resume.

In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Config): The radio resource configuration. Applicable in case of intra-E-UTRA handover. If the target receives an incomplete MeasConfig and/or RadioResourceConfigDedicated in the as-Config, the target eNB may decide to apply the full configuration option based on the ue-ConfigRelease.

In RRM-Config section description: The RRM-Config IE contains information about UE specific RRM information before the handover which can be utilized by target eNB.

In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (rrm-Config): Local E-UTRAN context used depending on the target node's implementation, which is mainly used for the RRM purpose. May also be provided at inter-RAT handover from NR.

Cond HO: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is mandatory present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In AS-Context section description: The IE AS-Context is used to transfer local E-UTRAN context required by the target eNB.

In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Context): Local E-UTRAN context required by the target eNB.
HandoverPreparationInformation-v920-IEs: ENUMERATED {rel9, rel10, rel11, rel12, v10j0, v11e0, v1280, rel13, ..., rel14, rel15}

Cond HO2: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (ue-ConfigRelease): Indicates the RRC protocol release or version applicable for the current UE configuration. This could be used by target eNB to decide if the full configuration approach should be used. If this field is not present, the target assumes that the current UE configuration is based on the release 8 version of RRC protocol. NOTE 1.
In HandoverPreparationInformation section: NOTE 1: The source typically sets the ue-ConfigRelease to the release corresponding with the current dedicated radio configuration. The source may however also consider the common radio resource configuration e.g. in case interoperability problems would appear if the UE temporary continues extensions of this part of the configuration in a target PCell not supporting them.
HandoverPreparationInformation-v10j0-IEs: In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Config): The radio resource configuration. Applicable in case of intra-E-UTRA handover. If the target receives an incomplete MeasConfig and/or RadioResourceConfigDedicated in the as-Config, the target eNB may decide to apply the full configuration option based on the ue-ConfigRelease.
HandoverPreparationInformation-v13c0-IEs: In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Config): The radio resource configuration. Applicable in case of intra-E-UTRA handover. If the target receives an incomplete MeasConfig and/or RadioResourceConfigDedicated in the as-Config, the target eNB may decide to apply the full configuration option based on the ue-ConfigRelease.
HandoverPreparationInformation-v9e0-IEs:
Cond HO2: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Config): The radio resource configuration. Applicable in case of intra-E-UTRA handover. If the target receives an incomplete MeasConfig and/or RadioResourceConfigDedicated in the as-Config, the target eNB may decide to apply the full configuration option based on the ue-ConfigRelease.
HandoverPreparationInformation-v1130-IEs:
Cond HO2: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Context): Local E-UTRAN context required by the target eNB.
HandoverPreparationInformation-v1250-IEs:
Cond HO3: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is optional present in case of handover from GERAN to E-UTRA, otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (ue-SupportedEARFCN): Includes UE supported EARFCN of the handover target E-UTRA cell if the target E-UTRA cell belongs to multiple frequency bands.

Cond HO2: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Config): The radio resource configuration. Applicable in case of intra-E-UTRA handover. If the target receives an incomplete MeasConfig and/or RadioResourceConfigDedicated in the as-Config, the target eNB may decide to apply the full configuration option based on the ue-ConfigRelease.
HandoverPreparationInformation-v1320-IEs:
Cond HO2: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Config): The radio resource configuration. Applicable in case of intra-E-UTRA handover. If the target receives an incomplete MeasConfig and/or RadioResourceConfigDedicated in the as-Config, the target eNB may decide to apply the full configuration option based on the ue-ConfigRelease.

Cond HO2: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Context): Local E-UTRAN context required by the target eNB.
HandoverPreparationInformation-v1430-IEs:
Cond HO2: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Config): The radio resource configuration. Applicable in case of intra-E-UTRA handover. If the target receives an incomplete MeasConfig and/or RadioResourceConfigDedicated in the as-Config, the target eNB may decide to apply the full configuration option based on the ue-ConfigRelease.

Cond HO2: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (makeBeforeBreakReq): To request the target eNB to add the makeBeforeBreak indication in the mobilityControlInfo in case of intra-frequency handover.
HandoverPreparationInformation-v1540-IEs:
Cond HO4: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is mandatory present in case of handover within E-UTRA/5GC and optional present in case of handover from NR to E-UTRA/5GC; otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (sourceRB-ConfigIntra5GC): NR radio bearer config used at intra5GC handover, as defined by RadioBearerConfig IE in TS 38.331 [82].
HandoverPreparationInformation-v16xy-IEs:
Cond HO5: In HandoverPreparationInformation: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA, or handover from NR to E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In HandoverPreparationInformation field description (as-Context): Local E-UTRAN context required by the target eNB.
SCG-Config-r12:
In SCG-Config section description: This message is used to transfer the SCG radio configuration generated by the SeNB.
Direction: Secondary eNB to master eNB
SCG-Config-r12-IEs:
In SCG-Config field description (scg-RadioConfig-r12): Includes the change of the dedicated SCG configuration and, upon addition of an SCG cell, the common SCG configuration.
The SeNB only includes a new SCG cell in response to a request from MeNB, but may include release of an SCG cell release or release of the SCG part of an SCG/Split DRB without prior request from MeNB. The SeNB does not use this field to initiate release of the SCG.
SCG-ConfigInfo-r12:
In SCG-ConfigInfo section description: This message is used by MeNB to request the SeNB to perform certain actions e.g. to establish, modify or release an SCG, and it may include additional information e.g. to assist the SeNB with assigning the SCG configuration.
Direction: Master eNB to secondary eNB
SCG-ConfigInfo-r12-IEs:
In RadioResourceConfigDedicated section description: The IE RadioResourceConfigDedicated is used to setup/modify/release RBs, to modify the MAC main configuration, to modify the SPS configuration and to modify dedicated physical configuration.

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (radioResourceConfigDedMCG): Includes the current dedicated MCG radio resource configuration.

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (sCellToAddModListMCG): Includes the current MCG SCell configuration. Field sCellToAddModListMCG is used to add the first 4 SCells with sCellIndex-r10 while sCellToAddModListMCG-Ext is used to add the rest.

In MeasGapConfig section description: The IE MeasGapConfig specifies the measurement gap configuration and controls setup/ release of measurement gaps.

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (measGapConfig): Includes the current measurement gap configuration.
measGapConfig in chapter5
In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (scg-RadioConfig): Includes the current dedicated SCG configuration.

In UECapabilityInformation section description: The UECapabilityInformation message is used to transfer of UE radio access capabilities requested by the E-UTRAN.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN
In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (scg-ConfigRestrictInfo): Includes fields for which MeNB explictly indicates the restriction to be observed by SeNB.

In MBMSInterestIndication section description: The MBMSInterestIndication message is used to inform E-UTRAN that the UE is receiving/ interested to receive or no longer receiving/ interested to receive MBMS via an MRB or SC-MRB including MBMS service(s) in receive only mode.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN
In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (measResultServCellListSCG): Includes measurement results of SCG (serving) cells.

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (drb-ToAddModListSCG): Includes DRBs the SeNB is requested to establish or modify (DRB type change).
drb-ToAddModListSCG in chapter5

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (drb-ToReleaseListSCG): Includes DRBs the SeNB is requested to release.
drb-ToReleaseListSCG in chapter5

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (sCellToAddModListSCG): Includes SCG cells the SeNB is requested to establish. Measurement results may be provided for these cells. Field sCellToAddModListSCG is used to add the first 4 SCells with sCellIndex-r12 while sCellToAddModListSCG-Ext is used to add the rest.
sCellToAddModListSCG in chapter5

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (sCellToReleaseListSCG): Includes SCG cells the SeNB is requested to release.
sCellToReleaseListSCG in chapter5

In P-Max section description: The IE P-Max is used to limit the UE's uplink transmission power on a carrier frequency and is used to calculate the parameter Pcompensation defined in TS 36.304 [4]. Corresponds to parameter PEMAX or PEMAX,c in TS 36.101 [42]. The UE transmit power on one serving cell shall not exceed the configured maximum UE output power of the serving cell determined by this value as specified in TS 36.101 [42], clauses 6.2.5 or 6.2.5A, or, when transmitting sidelink discovery announcements within the coverage of the concerned cell, as specified in TS 36.101 [42], clause 6.2.5D.

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (p-Max): Cell specific value i.e. as broadcast by PCell.
p-Max in chapter5
SCG-ConfigInfo-v1310-IEs:
In MeasResultSSTD section description: The IE MeasResultSSTD consists of SFN, radio frame and subframe boundary difference between the PCell and the PSCell as specified in TS 36.214 [48] and TS 36.133 [16].

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (measResultSSTD): Includes measurement results of UE SFN and Subframe Timing Difference between the PCell and the PSCell.
measResultSSTD in chapter5

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (sCellToAddModListMCG-Ext): Includes the current MCG SCell configuration. Field sCellToAddModListMCG is used to add the first 4 SCells with sCellIndex-r10 while sCellToAddModListMCG-Ext is used to add the rest.

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (sCellToAddModListSCG-Ext): Includes SCG cells the SeNB is requested to establish. Measurement results may be provided for these cells. Field sCellToAddModListSCG is used to add the first 4 SCells with sCellIndex-r12 while sCellToAddModListSCG-Ext is used to add the rest.
In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (sCellToReleaseListSCG-Ext): Includes SCG cells the SeNB is requested to release.
SCG-ConfigInfo-v1330-IEs: In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (measResultListRSSI-SCG): Includes RSSI measurement results of SCG (serving) cells
SCG-ConfigInfo-v1430-IEs: In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (makeBeforeBreakSCG-Req): To request the target eNB to add the makeBeforeBreakSCG indication in the mobilityControlInfoSCG in case of intra-frequency SCG change.

In MeasGapConfigPerCC-List section description: The IE MeasGapConfigPerCC-List specifies the measurement gap configuration and controls setup/ release of measurement gaps.
measGapConfigPerCC-List in chapter5
SCG-ConfigInfo-v1530-IEs:
In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (drb-ToAddModListSCG): Includes DRBs the SeNB is requested to establish or modify (DRB type change).
drb-ToAddModListSCG in chapter5

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (drb-ToReleaseListSCG): Includes DRBs the SeNB is requested to release.
drb-ToReleaseListSCG in chapter5
DRB-InfoSCG-r12:
Cond DRB-Setup: In SCG-ConfigInfo: The field is mandatory present in case DRB establishment is requested; otherwise the field is not present.
eps-BearerIdentity in chapter5

In DRB-Identity section description: The IE DRB-Identity is used to identify a DRB used by a UE.
drb-Identity in chapter5

Cond DRB-Setup: In SCG-ConfigInfo: The field is mandatory present in case DRB establishment is requested; otherwise the field is not present.
drb-Type in chapter5
Cell-ToAddMod-r12:
In SCellIndex section description: The IE SCellIndex concerns a short identity, used to identify an SCell.

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (sCellIndex): If sCellIndex-r13 is present, sCellIndex-r12 shall be ignored.
sCellIndex in chapter5

Cond SCellAdd: In SCG-ConfigInfo: The field is mandatory present in case SCG cell establishment is requested; otherwise the field is not present.
cellIdentification in chapter5

In PhysCellId section description: The IE PhysCellId is used to indicate the physical layer identity of the cell, as defined in TS 36.211 [21].
physCellId in chapter5
Cond SCellAdd2: In SCG-ConfigInfo: The field is optional present in case SCG cell establishment is requested; otherwise the field is not present.

In RSRP-Range section description: The IE RSRP-Range specifies the value range used in RSRP measurements and thresholds. Integer value for RSRP measurements according to mapping table in TS 36.133 [16]. A given field using RSRP-Range-v1360 shall only be signalled if the corresponding original field (using RSRP-Range i.e. without suffix) is set to value 0.
rsrpResult in chapter5

In RSRQ-Range section description: The IE RSRQ-Range specifies the value range used in RSRQ measurements and thresholds. Integer value for RSRQ measurements is according to mapping table in TS 36.133 [16]. A given field using RSRQ-Range-v1250 shall only be signalled if the corresponding original field (using RSRQ-Range i.e. without suffix) is set to value 0 or 34. Only a UE indicating support of extendedRSRQ-LowerRange-r12 or rsrq-OnAllSymbols-r12 may report RSRQ-Range-v1250, and this may be done without explicit configuration from the E-UTRAN. If received, the UE shall use the value indicated by the RSRQ-Range-v1250 and ignore the value signalled by RSRQ-Range (without the suffix). RSRQ-Range-r13 covers the original range and extended RSRQ-Range-v1250. RSRQ-Range-r13 may be signalled without the corresponding original field and without any requirements for indicated support of extendedRSRQ-LowerRange-r12 or rsrq-OnAllSymbols-r12.
rsrqResult in chapter5

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (sCellIndex): If sCellIndex-r13 is present, sCellIndex-r12 shall be ignored.
sCellIndex in chapter5
Cond SCellAdd2: In SCG-ConfigInfo: The field is optional present in case SCG cell establishment is requested; otherwise the field is not present.

In RS-SINR-Range section description: The IE RS-SINR-Range specifies the value range used in RS-SINR measurements and thresholds. Integer value for RS-SINR measurements is according to mapping table in TS 36.133 [16].
MeasResultServCellSCG-r12:
In ServCellIndex section description: The IE ServCellIndex concerns a short identity, used to identify a serving cell (i.e. the PCell or an SCell). Value 0 applies for the PCell, while the SCellIndex that has previously been assigned applies for SCells.

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (servCellId): If servCellId-r13 is present, servCellId-r12 shall be ignored.
servCellId in chapter5

In RSRP-Range section description: The IE RSRP-Range specifies the value range used in RSRP measurements and thresholds. Integer value for RSRP measurements according to mapping table in TS 36.133 [16]. A given field using RSRP-Range-v1360 shall only be signalled if the corresponding original field (using RSRP-Range i.e. without suffix) is set to value 0.

In RSRQ-Range section description: The IE RSRQ-Range specifies the value range used in RSRQ measurements and thresholds. Integer value for RSRQ measurements is according to mapping table in TS 36.133 [16]. A given field using RSRQ-Range-v1250 shall only be signalled if the corresponding original field (using RSRQ-Range i.e. without suffix) is set to value 0 or 34. Only a UE indicating support of extendedRSRQ-LowerRange-r12 or rsrq-OnAllSymbols-r12 may report RSRQ-Range-v1250, and this may be done without explicit configuration from the E-UTRAN. If received, the UE shall use the value indicated by the RSRQ-Range-v1250 and ignore the value signalled by RSRQ-Range (without the suffix). RSRQ-Range-r13 covers the original range and extended RSRQ-Range-v1250. RSRQ-Range-r13 may be signalled without the corresponding original field and without any requirements for indicated support of extendedRSRQ-LowerRange-r12 or rsrq-OnAllSymbols-r12.

In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (servCellId): If servCellId-r13 is present, servCellId-r12 shall be ignored.
servCellId in chapter5

In RS-SINR-Range section description: The IE RS-SINR-Range specifies the value range used in RS-SINR measurements and thresholds. Integer value for RS-SINR measurements is according to mapping table in TS 36.133 [16].
MeasResultRSSI-SCG-r13:
In SCG-ConfigInfo field description (servCellId): If servCellId-r13 is present, servCellId-r12 shall be ignored.
servCellId in chapter5
UEPagingCoverageInformation:
In UEPagingCoverageInformation section description: This message is used to transfer UE paging coverage information, covering both upload to and download from the EPC.
Direction: eNB to/from EPC
UEPagingCoverageInformation-r13-IEs: In UEPagingCoverageInformation field description (mpdcch-NumRepetition): Number of repetitions for MPDCCH. The value is an estimate of the required number of repetitions for MPDCCH for paging.
UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation:
In UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation section description: This message is used to transfer UE radio access capability information, covering both upload to and download from the EPC.
Direction: eNB to/ from EPC
UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation-r8-IE: In UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation field description (ue-RadioAccessCapabilityInfo): Including E-UTRA, GERAN, CDMA2000-1xRTT Bandclass, NR and MR-DC radio access capabilities (separated). UTRA radio access capabilities are not included. For E-UTRA radio access capabilities, it is up to E-UTRA how the backward compatibility among supportedBandCombinationReduced, supportedBandCombination and supportedBandCombinationAdd is ensured. If supportedBandCombinationReduced and supportedBandCombination/supportedBandCombinationAdd are included into ueCapabilityRAT-Container, it can be assumed that the value of fields, requestedBands, reducedIntNonContCombRequested and requestedCCsXL are consistent with all supported band combination fields.

In UECapabilityInformation section description: The UECapabilityInformation message is used to transfer of UE radio access capabilities requested by the E-UTRAN.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN
UERadioPagingInformation:
In UERadioPagingInformation section description: This message is used to transfer radio paging information, covering both upload to and download from the EPC/5GC.
Direction: eNB to/ from EPC/5GC
UERadioPagingInformation-r12-IEs:
In UERadioPagingInformation field description (ue-RadioPagingInfo): The field is used to transfer UE capability information used for paging. The eNB generates the ue-RadioPagingInfo and the contained UE capability information is absent when not supported by the UE.
ue-RadioPagingInfo in chapter5
In UE-RadioPagingInfo section description: The UE-RadioPagingInfo IE contains UE capability information needed for paging.
UERadioPagingInformation-v1310-IEs: In UERadioPagingInformation field description (supportedBandListEUTRAForPaging): Indicates the UE supported frequency bands which is derived by the eNB from UE-EUTRA-Capability.
UERadioPagingInformation-v16xy-IEs:
In UERadioPagingInformation field description (accessStratumRelease): Indicates that the UE supports reception of accessType-r16 in the Paging message.

In 36306-g00 4.3.8.1 accessStratumRelease
This field defines the release of the E-UTRA layer 1, 2, and 3 specifications supported by the UE e.g. Rel-8, Rel-9, etc.
AS-Config: In AS-Config section description: The AS-Config IE contains information about RRC configuration information in the source eNB which can be utilized by target eNB to determine the need to change the RRC configuration during the handover preparation phase. The information can also be used after the handover is successfully performed or during the RRC connection re-establishment or resume.

In MeasConfig section description: The IE MeasConfig specifies measurements to be performed by the UE, and covers intra-frequency, inter-frequency and inter-RAT mobility as well as configuration of measurement gaps.

In AS-Config field description (sourceMeasConfig): Measurement configuration in the source cell. The measurement configuration for all measurements existing in the source eNB when handover is triggered shall be included. See 10.5.

In RadioResourceConfigDedicated section description: The IE RadioResourceConfigDedicated is used to setup/modify/release RBs, to modify the MAC main configuration, to modify the SPS configuration and to modify dedicated physical configuration.

In AS-Config field description (sourceRadioResourceConfig): Radio configuration in the source PCell. The radio resource configuration for all radio bearers existing in the source PCell when handover is triggered shall be included. See 10.5.

In SecurityAlgorithmConfig section description: The IE SecurityAlgorithmConfig is used to configure AS integrity protection algorithm (SRBs) and AS ciphering algorithm (SRBs and DRBs). For RNs, the IE SecurityAlgorithmConfig is also used to configure AS integrity protection algorithm for DRBs between the RN and the E-UTRAN.

In AS-Config field description (sourceSecurityAlgorithmConfig): This field provides the AS integrity protection (SRBs) and AS ciphering (SRBs and DRBs) algorithm configuration used in the source PCell.
In C-RNTI section description: The IE C-RNTI identifies a UE having a RRC connection within a cell.

In MasterInformationBlock section description: The MasterInformationBlock includes the system information transmitted on BCH.
Signalling radio bearer: N/A
RLC-SAP: TM
Logical channel: BCCH
Direction: E-UTRAN to UE
MasterInformationBlock

In AS-Config field description (sourceMasterInformationBlock): MasterInformationBlock transmitted in the source PCell.

In SystemInformationBlockType1 section description: SystemInformationBlockType1 contains information relevant when evaluating if a UE is allowed to access a cell and defines the scheduling of other system information. SystemInformationBlockType1-BR uses the same structure as SystemInformationBlockType1.
Signalling radio bearer: N/A
RLC-SAP: TM
Logical channels: BCCH and BR-BCCH
Direction: E-UTRAN to UE

In AS-Config field description (sourceSystemInformationBlockType1): SystemInformationBlockType1 (or SystemInformationBlockType1-BR) transmitted in the source PCell.

In SystemInformationBlockType2 section description: The IE SystemInformationBlockType2 contains radio resource configuration information that is common for all UEs.
NOTE: UE timers and constants related to functionality for which parameters are provided in another SIB are included in the corresponding SIB.

In AS-Config field description (sourceSystemInformationBlockType2): SystemInformationBlockType2 transmitted in the source PCell.

In AntennaInfo section description: The IE AntennaInfoCommon and the AntennaInfoDedicated are used to specify the common and the UE specific antenna configuration respectively.

In AS-Config field description (antennaInfoCommon): This field provides information about the number of antenna ports in the source PCell.

In ARFCN-ValueEUTRA section description: The IE ARFCN-ValueEUTRA is used to indicate the ARFCN applicable for a downlink, uplink or bi-directional (TDD) E-UTRA carrier frequency, as defined in TS 36.101 [42]. If an extension is signalled using the extended value range (as defined by IE ARFCN-ValueEUTRA-v9e0), the UE shall only consider this extension (and hence ignore the corresponding original field, using the value range as defined by IE ARFCN-ValueEUTRA i.e. without suffix, if signalled). In dedicated signalling, E-UTRAN only provides an EARFCN corresponding to an E-UTRA band supported by the UE.

In AS-Config field description (sourceDL-CarrierFreq): Provides the parameter Downlink EARFCN in the source PCell, see TS 36.101 [42]. If the source eNB provides AS-Config-v9e0, it sets sourceDl-CarrierFreq (i.e. without suffix) to maxEARFCN.

In OtherConfig section description: The IE OtherConfig contains configuration related to other configuration.

In AS-Config field description (sourceOtherConfig): Provides other configuration in the source PCell.
In AS-Config field description (sourceSCellConfigList): Radio resource configuration (common and dedicated) of the SCells configured in the source eNB.

In SCG-Config section description: This message is used to transfer the SCG radio configuration generated by the SeNB.
Direction: Secondary eNB to master eNB
AS-Config-v9e0: In AS-Config field description (sourceDL-CarrierFreq): Provides the parameter Downlink EARFCN in the source PCell, see TS 36.101 [42]. If the source eNB provides AS-Config-v9e0, it sets sourceDl-CarrierFreq (i.e. without suffix) to maxEARFCN.
AS-Config-v1250: In WLAN-OffloadConfig section description: The IE WLAN-OffloadConfig includes information for traffic steering between E-UTRAN and WLAN. The fields are applicable to both RAN-assisted WLAN interworking based on access network selection and traffic steering rules and RAN-assisted WLAN interworking based on ANDSF policies unless stated otherwise in the field description.

In SL-CommConfig section description: The IE SL-CommConfig specifies the dedicated configuration information for sidelink communication. In particular it concerns the transmission resource configuration for sidelink communication on the primary frequency.

In AS-Config field description (sourceSL-CommConfig): This field covers the sidelink communication configuration.

In SL-DiscConfig section description: The IE SL-DiscConfig specifies the dedicated configuration information for sidelink discovery.

In AS-Config field description (sourceSL-DiscConfig): This field covers the sidelink discovery configuration.
AS-Config-v1320: In AS-Config field description (sourceSCellConfigList): Radio resource configuration (common and dedicated) of the SCells configured in the source eNB.

In RCLWI-Configuration section description: The IE RCLWI-Configuration is used to add, modify or release the RCLWI configuration.

In AS-Config field description (sourceRCLWI-Configuration): RCLWI Configuration in the source PCell.
AS-Config-v1430:
In SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated section description: The IE SL-V2X-ConfigDedicated specifies the dedicated configuration information for V2X sidelink communication.

In AS-Config field description (sourceSL-V2X-CommConfig): Indicates the V2X sidelink communication related configurations configured in the source eNB.
In AS-Config field description (sourceLWA-Config): LWA configuration in the source PCell when handover is triggered.
In AS-Config field description (sourceWLAN-MeasResult): WLAN measurement results in the source PCell when handover is triggered.
AS-ConfigNR-r15: In AS-Config field description (sourceRB-ConfigNR): NR radio bearer config, as defined by RadioBearerConfig IE in TS 38.331 [82]. The field may e.g. be set by MN in case of (NG)EN-DC, by source eNB connected to 5GCN.
In AS-Config field description (sourceRB-ConfigSN-NR): NR radio bearer config set by SN in case of (NG)EN-DC or of SN terminated RB without SCG, as defined by RadioBearerConfig IE in TS 38.331 [82].
In AS-Config field description (sourceOtherConfigSN-NR): Other NR config set by SN (cell group, measurements) in case of (NG)EN-DC i.e. as defined by the RRCReconfiguration message in TS 38.331 [82].
AS-ConfigNR-v1570: In AS-Config field description (sourceSCG-ConfiguredNR): Value true indicates that the UE is configured with NR SCG in source configuration. The field is included only if sourceOtherConfigSN-NR is not included.
AS-Config-v1550:
In AS-Config field description (tdm-PatternConfig): Indicates the TDM pattern configuration in the source PCell.
tdm-PatternConfig in chapter5
ENUMERATED {sa0, sa1, sa2, sa3, sa4, sa5, sa6}

In P-Max section description: The IE P-Max is used to limit the UE's uplink transmission power on a carrier frequency and is used to calculate the parameter Pcompensation defined in TS 36.304 [4]. Corresponds to parameter PEMAX or PEMAX,c in TS 36.101 [42]. The UE transmit power on one serving cell shall not exceed the configured maximum UE output power of the serving cell determined by this value as specified in TS 36.101 [42], clauses 6.2.5 or 6.2.5A, or, when transmitting sidelink discovery announcements within the coverage of the concerned cell, as specified in TS 36.101 [42], clause 6.2.5D.

In AS-Config field description (p-MaxEUTRA): Indicates the p-MaxEUTRA in the source PCell.
p-MaxEUTRA in chapter5
AS-Context: In AS-Context section description: The IE AS-Context is used to transfer local E-UTRAN context required by the target eNB.

Cond HO: In AS-Context: The field is mandatory present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In ReestablishmentInfo section description: The ReestablishmentInfo IE contains information needed for the RRC connection re-establishment.

In AS-Context field description (reestablishmentInfo): Including information needed for the RRC connection re-establishment.
AS-Context-v1130:
Cond HO2: In AS-Context: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In AS-Context field description (idc-Indication): Including information used for handling the IDC problems.
idc-Indication in chapter5

In InDeviceCoexIndication section description: The InDeviceCoexIndication message is used to inform E-UTRAN about IDC problems which can not be solved by the UE itself, as well as to provide information that may assist E-UTRAN when resolving these problems.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN
Cond HO2: In AS-Context: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.

In MBMSInterestIndication section description: The MBMSInterestIndication message is used to inform E-UTRAN that the UE is receiving/ interested to receive or no longer receiving/ interested to receive MBMS via an MRB or SC-MRB including MBMS service(s) in receive only mode.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN

Cond HO2: In AS-Context: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
powerPrefIndication in chapter5

In UEAssistanceInformation section description: The UEAssistanceInformation message is used for the indication of UE assistance information to the eNB.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN
Cond HO2: In AS-Context: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.

In SidelinkUEInformation section description: The SidelinkUEInformation message is used for the indication of sidelink information to the eNB.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN

Cond HO2: In AS-Context: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In AS-Context field description (sourceContextEN-DC): (NG)EN-DC related context information, in particular regarding the UE capability coordination, as defined by the ConfigRestrictInfoSCG IE specified in TS 38.331 [82].

Cond HO2: In AS-Context: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.
In AS-Context field description (selectedBandCombinationInfoEN-DC): Including the BandCombinationInfoSN IE specified in TS 38.331 [82]. See NOTE 1.
In AS-Context section: NOTE 1: If the field is present, it is used to help target MN to decide appropriate LTE band for SCell frequency measurement in case of inter-MN handover without SN change.
AS-Context-v1320: Cond HO2: In AS-Context: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.

In WLANConnectionStatusReport section description: The WLANConnectionStatusReport message is used to inform the successful connection to WLAN or failure of the WLAN connection or connection attempt(s).
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN
AS-Context-v16xy: Cond HO3: In AS-Context: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA, or handover from NR to E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.

In SidelinkUEInformationNR section description: The SidelinkUEInformationNR message is used for the indication of NR sidelink information to the eNB.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN
Cond HO3: In AS-Context: The field is optional present in case of handover within E-UTRA, or handover from NR to E-UTRA; otherwise the field is not present.

In UEAssistanceInformationNR section description: The UEAssistanceInformationNR message is used for the indication of UE assistance information to the eNB.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN
ReestablishmentInfo: In ReestablishmentInfo section description: The ReestablishmentInfo IE contains information needed for the RRC connection re-establishment.
In PhysCellId section description: The IE PhysCellId is used to indicate the physical layer identity of the cell, as defined in TS 36.211 [21].

In ShortMAC-I section description: The IE ShortMAC-I is used to identify and verify the UE at RRC connection re-establishment. The 16 least significant bits of the MAC-I calculated using the security configuration of the source PCell, as specified in 5.3.7.4.

In ReestablishmentInfo field description (targetCellShortMAC-I): The ShortMAC-I for the handover target PCell, in order for potential re-establishment to succeed.

In ReestablishmentInfo field description (additionalReestabInfoList): Contains a list of shortMAC-I and KeNB* for cells under control of the target eNB, required for potential re-establishment by the UE in these cells to succeed.
AdditionalReestabInfo:
In CellIdentity section description: The IE CellIdentity is used to unambiguously identify a cell within a PLMN.
cellIdentity in chapter5

In ReestablishmentInfo field description (Key-eNodeB-Star): Parameter KeNB*: See TS 33.401 [32], clause 7.2.8.4. If the cell identified by cellIdentity belongs to multiple frequency bands, the source eNB selects the DL-EARFCN for the KeNB* calculation using the same logic as UE uses when selecting the DL-EARFCN in IDLE as defined in clause 6.2.2. This parameter is only used for X2 handover, and for S1 handover, it shall be ignored by target eNB.

In ShortMAC-I section description: The IE ShortMAC-I is used to identify and verify the UE at RRC connection re-establishment. The 16 least significant bits of the MAC-I calculated using the security configuration of the source PCell, as specified in 5.3.7.4.
shortMAC-I in chapter5
RRM-Config: In RRM-Config section description: The RRM-Config IE contains information about UE specific RRM information before the handover which can be utilized by target eNB.

ENUMERATED {s1, s2, s3, s5, s7, s10, s15, s20, s25, s30, s40, s50, min1, min1s20c, min1s40, min2, min2s30, min3, min3s30, min4, min5, min6, min7, min8, min9, min10, min12, min14, min17, min20, min24, min28, min33, min38, min44, min50, hr1, hr1min30, hr2, hr2min30, hr3, hr3min30, hr4, hr5, hr6, hr8, hr10, hr13, hr16, hr20, day1, day1hr12, day2, day2hr12, day3, day4, day5, day7, day10, day14, day19, day24, day30, dayMoreThan30}

In RRM-Config field description (ue-InactiveTime): Duration while UE has not received or transmitted any user data. Thus the timer is still running in case e.g., UE measures the neighbour cells for the HO purpose. Value s1 corresponds to 1 second, s2 corresponds to 2 seconds and so on. Value min1 corresponds to 1 minute, value min1s20 corresponds to 1 minute and 20 seconds, value min1s40 corresponds to 1 minute and 40 seconds and so on. Value hr1 corresponds to 1 hour, hr1min30 corresponds to 1 hour and 30 minutes and so on.
In RRM-Config field description (candidateCellInfoList): A list of the best cells on each frequency for which measurement information was available, in order of decreasing RSRP.

In RRM-Config field description (candidateCellInfoListNR): A list of NR cells including serving cells and best neighbour cells on each SSB requency, for which measurement results were available, and for each cell the best beams.
CandidateCellInfo-r10:
In PhysCellId section description: The IE PhysCellId is used to indicate the physical layer identity of the cell, as defined in TS 36.211 [21].
physCellId in chapter5

In ARFCN-ValueEUTRA section description: The IE ARFCN-ValueEUTRA is used to indicate the ARFCN applicable for a downlink, uplink or bi-directional (TDD) E-UTRA carrier frequency, as defined in TS 36.101 [42]. If an extension is signalled using the extended value range (as defined by IE ARFCN-ValueEUTRA-v9e0), the UE shall only consider this extension (and hence ignore the corresponding original field, using the value range as defined by IE ARFCN-ValueEUTRA i.e. without suffix, if signalled). In dedicated signalling, E-UTRAN only provides an EARFCN corresponding to an E-UTRA band supported by the UE.

In RRM-Config field description (dl-CarrierFreq): The source includes dl-CarrierFreq-v1090 if and only if dl-CarrierFreq-r10 is set to maxEARFCN.

In RSRP-Range section description: The IE RSRP-Range specifies the value range used in RSRP measurements and thresholds. Integer value for RSRP measurements according to mapping table in TS 36.133 [16]. A given field using RSRP-Range-v1360 shall only be signalled if the corresponding original field (using RSRP-Range i.e. without suffix) is set to value 0.
rsrpResult in chapter5

In RSRQ-Range section description: The IE RSRQ-Range specifies the value range used in RSRQ measurements and thresholds. Integer value for RSRQ measurements is according to mapping table in TS 36.133 [16]. A given field using RSRQ-Range-v1250 shall only be signalled if the corresponding original field (using RSRQ-Range i.e. without suffix) is set to value 0 or 34. Only a UE indicating support of extendedRSRQ-LowerRange-r12 or rsrq-OnAllSymbols-r12 may report RSRQ-Range-v1250, and this may be done without explicit configuration from the E-UTRAN. If received, the UE shall use the value indicated by the RSRQ-Range-v1250 and ignore the value signalled by RSRQ-Range (without the suffix). RSRQ-Range-r13 covers the original range and extended RSRQ-Range-v1250. RSRQ-Range-r13 may be signalled without the corresponding original field and without any requirements for indicated support of extendedRSRQ-LowerRange-r12 or rsrq-OnAllSymbols-r12.
rsrqResult in chapter5
In RRM-Config field description (dl-CarrierFreq): The source includes dl-CarrierFreq-v1090 if and only if dl-CarrierFreq-r10 is set to maxEARFCN.

In RS-SINR-Range section description: The IE RS-SINR-Range specifies the value range used in RS-SINR measurements and thresholds. Integer value for RS-SINR measurements is according to mapping table in TS 36.133 [16].
HandoverPreparationInformation-NB:
In HandoverPreparationInformation-NB section description: This message is used to transfer the UE context from the eNB where the RRC connection has been suspended and transfer it to the eNB where the RRC Connection has been requested to be resumed.
Direction: source eNB to target eNB
HandoverPreparationInformation-NB-IEs:
In UE-Capability-NB section description: The IE UE-Capability-NB is used to convey the NB-IoT UE Radio Access Capability Parameters, see TS 36.306 [5]. The IE UE-Capability-NB is transferred in NB-IoT only.

In HandoverPreparationInformation-NB field description (ue-RadioAccessCapabilityInfo): The NB-IoT UE Radio Access Capability Parameters, see TS 36.306 [5].

In AS-Config-NB section description: The AS-Config-NB IE contains information about NB-IoT RRC configuration information in the source eNB which can be utilized by target eNB.

In HandoverPreparationInformation-NB field description (as-Config): The radio resource configuration.

In RRM-Config-NB section description: The RRM-Config-NB IE contains information about UE specific RRM information which can be utilized by target eNB.

In HandoverPreparationInformation-NB field description (rrm-Config): The local E-UTRAN context used depending on the target node's implementation, which is mainly used for the RRM purpose.

In AS-Context-NB section description: The IE AS-Context-NB is used to transfer the UE context required by the target eNB.

In HandoverPreparationInformation-NB field description (as-Context): The local E-UTRAN context required by the target eNB.
HandoverPreparationInformation-NB-Ext-r1: In HandoverPreparationInformation-NB field description (ue-RadioAccessCapabilityInfoExt): The NB-IoT UE Radio Access Capability Parameters, see TS 36.306 [5].
UEPagingCoverageInformation-NB:
In UEPagingCoverageInformation-NB section description: This message is used to transfer UE paging coverage information for NB-IoT, covering both upload to and download from the EPC.
Direction: eNB to/from EPC
UEPagingCoverageInformation-NB-IEs: In UEPagingCoverageInformation-NB field description (npdcch-NumRepetitionPaging): Number of repetitions for NPDCCH, see TS 36.211 [21].This value is an estimate of the required number of repetitions for NPDCCH.
UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation-NB:
In UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation-NB section description: This message is used to transfer UE NB-IoT Radio Access capability information, covering both upload to and download from the EPC.
Direction: eNB to/ from EPC
UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation-NB-IE: In UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation-NB field description (ue-RadioAccessCapabilityInfo): The NB-IoT UE Radio Access Capability Parameters, see TS 36.306 [5].

In UE-Capability-NB section description: The IE UE-Capability-NB is used to convey the NB-IoT UE Radio Access Capability Parameters, see TS 36.306 [5]. The IE UE-Capability-NB is transferred in NB-IoT only.
UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation-NB-r1: In UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation-NB field description (ue-RadioAccessCapabilityInfo): The NB-IoT UE Radio Access Capability Parameters, see TS 36.306 [5].

In UECapabilityInformation-NB section description: The UECapabilityInformation-NB message is used to transfer of UE radio access capabilities requested by the E-UTRAN.
Signalling radio bearer: SRB1 or SRB1bis
RLC-SAP: AM
Logical channel: DCCH
Direction: UE to E-UTRAN
UERadioPagingInformation-NB:
In UERadioPagingInformation-NB section description: This message is used to transfer NB-IoT radio paging information, covering both upload to and download from the EPC.
Direction: eNB to/ from EPC
UERadioPagingInformation-NB-IEs:
In UERadioPagingInformation-NB field description (ue-RadioPagingInfo): The field is used to transfer UE NB-IoT capability information used for paging. The eNB generates the ue-RadioPagingInfo and the contained UE capability information is absent when not supported bythe UE.
ue-RadioPagingInfo in chapter5
In UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB section description: The IE UE-RadioPagingInfo-NB contains UE NB-IoT capability information needed for paging.
AS-Config-NB: In AS-Config-NB section description: The AS-Config-NB IE contains information about NB-IoT RRC configuration information in the source eNB which can be utilized by target eNB.

In RadioResourceConfigDedicated-NB section description: The IE RadioResourceConfigDedicated-NB is used to setup/modify/release RBs, to modify the MAC main configuration, and to modify dedicated physical configuration.

In AS-Config-NB field description (sourceRadioResourceConfig): Radio configuration in the source PCell. The radio resource configuration for all radio bearers existing in the source PCell shall be included. See 10.9.

In SecurityAlgorithmConfig section description: The IE SecurityAlgorithmConfig is used to configure AS integrity protection algorithm (SRBs) and AS ciphering algorithm (SRBs and DRBs). For RNs, the IE SecurityAlgorithmConfig is also used to configure AS integrity protection algorithm for DRBs between the RN and the E-UTRAN.

In AS-Config-NB field description (sourceSecurityAlgorithmConfig): This field provides the AS integrity protection (SRBs) and AS ciphering (SRBs and DRBs) algorithm configuration used in the source PCell.
In C-RNTI section description: The IE C-RNTI identifies a UE having a RRC connection within a cell.

In CarrierFreq-NB section description: The IE CarrierFreq-NB is used to provide the NB-IoT carrier frequency, as defined in TS 36.101 [42].

In AS-Config-NB field description (sourceDL-CarrierFreq): Provides the parameter Downlink EARFCN in the source PCell, see TS 36.101 [42].

Cond TDD: In AS-Config-NB: The field is optionally present in case of TDD; otherwise the field is not present.
In AS-Config-NB field description (sourceDL-CarrierFreq): Provides the parameter Downlink EARFCN in the source PCell, see TS 36.101 [42].
AS-Context-NB: In AS-Context-NB section description: The IE AS-Context-NB is used to transfer the UE context required by the target eNB.

In ReestablishmentInfo-NB section description: The ReestablishmentInfo-NB IE contains information needed for the RRC connection re-establishment.

In AS-Context-NB field description (reestablishmentInfo): Including information needed for the RRC connection re-establishment.
ReestablishmentInfo-NB: In ReestablishmentInfo-NB section description: The ReestablishmentInfo-NB IE contains information needed for the RRC connection re-establishment.
In PhysCellId section description: The IE PhysCellId is used to indicate the physical layer identity of the cell, as defined in TS 36.211 [21].

In ShortMAC-I section description: The IE ShortMAC-I is used to identify and verify the UE at RRC connection re-establishment. The 16 least significant bits of the MAC-I calculated using the security configuration of the source PCell, as specified in 5.3.7.4.

In ReestablishmentInfo-NB field description (targetCellShortMAC-I): The ShortMAC-I for the target PCell, in order for potential re-establishment to succeed.

In ReestablishmentInfo-NB field description (additionalReestabInfoList): Contains a list of shortMAC-I and KeNB* for cells under control of the target eNB, required for potential re-establishment by the UE in these cells to succeed.
RRM-Config-NB: In RRM-Config-NB section description: The RRM-Config-NB IE contains information about UE specific RRM information which can be utilized by target eNB.
